https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/919451.name: Entry Level Cashier / Assistant Manager
https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/919451.description:
We want all of our guests to enjoy the "Holiday Feeling". The warm and exciting feeling you get when you are on a vacation with family or friends. All of our sales associates should treat our guests in such a way that the Holiday Feeling is magnified in their shopping experience.

Cashier / Assistant Manager

Holiday Oil is looking to hire both part-time and full-time positions for our northern Utah locations. Are you a customer service rockstar looking for a positive environment to work in? Do you like to be where the action is? Would you like to work at a favorite stop in your community? Are you looking for a part-time job with a flexible schedule? Then, what are you waiting for? Apply now!

This Cashier / Assistant Manager position ranges from $12 - $17/hr, depending on experience. We also offer annual raises, paid time off that starts accruing immediately, holiday pay, customer service bonuses, a 401(k) plan with a company match, profit sharing, and a free car wash voucher with every paycheck. Medical, dental, and vision insurance are offered to full-time employees. If this sounds like the right part-time/full-time customer service opportunity for you, apply today!

ABOUT HOLIDAY OIL

Our convenience stores offer a wide range of everyday items for everyone in the family. We pride ourselves on our clean and friendly stores. We want all of our guests to enjoy that "holiday feeling." That's the warm and exciting feeling you get when you are on a vacation with family or friends. Each and every guest is warmly greeted, listened to, shown proper respect, and served with speed and a smile.

This is only possible through the dedication of our valued employees. We believe in rewarding hard work! We offer competitive pay, great benefits, and a positive work environment.

Are you friendly? Do you have excellent interpersonal skills? Are you reliable and trustworthy? Are you self-motivated and able to work independently? Are you looking for a steady part-time/full-time job? If so, then you might just be perfect for this customer service position!

CONVENIENCE STORE WORK SCHEDULE

This is a part-time/full-time customer service posting. Hours are flexible and vary. Our convenience stores are open Sunday - Saturday, 5 am - midnight. Schedules may change for summer or winter.

READY TO JOIN OUR CONVENIENCE STORE TEAM?

We understand your time is valuable and that is why we have a very quick and easy application process. If you feel that you would be right for this Cashier / Assistant Manager position at one of our convenience stores, please fill out our initial 3-minute mobile-friendly application. We look forward to meeting you!

https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/919448.name: Mental Heath Social Practitioner
https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/919448.description:
Do you want to be part of a dynamic, growing organization? Summit County Clubhouse is seeking a part-time staff Social Practitioner to provide psychosocial rehabilitation services to adults living with mental illness in accordance with the standards of Clubhouse International (clubhouse-intl.org/).

Summit County Clubhouse supports adult members (program participants) on their journey of recovery and reintegration into the community. The Social Practitioner works in partnership with the Clubhouse members and the Director.

The Social Practitioner helps members meet their needs for employment, housing, education, friendship, structure, and stability. This is NOT a desk job or a case management position. Clubhouse members are involved in doing everything necessary to run their own program (admin., cooking, cleaning, events, mental health advocacy, etc.) and staff works hands-on alongside the members.

This position is part time, 24 hours per week,

https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/918995.name: SALES Building Automation System, HVAC DDC Controls – Commercial
https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/918995.description:
One of the largest systems integrator's in the Inter-mountain West has immediate openings for an experienced DDC Control systems / automation sales person in Salt Lake City, Utah. We have offices in 3 Western States and employ a core staff of 100+ personnel consisting of technicians, electricians, engineers, salesmen, project managers, and administrative staff allowing us to provide a full range of services and products.

If you have outside sales experience in large scale integrated control systems we are looking for you. This position requires good knowledge of sales and marketing, HVAC systems, software. We are looking for a logical, detail oriented person with excellent customer service skills and the ability to interface and communicate with customers clearly and effectively.

This position is responsible for all phases of sales and marketing. The large portion of each week will be spent out seeing new and prospective customers with the goal of generating new business. You will be required to work on multiple projects simultaneously and pursue new leads at the direction of the Director of Business Development.

While most your time will be spent selling, your other responsibilities may include the coordination of various tasks including site visits, system design, estimating, writing proposals and coordination of installation dates. The position requires precise communication and coordination with the Customers, the Sales Department, the Operations Manager, the Project Managers, Contractors, Sub-Contractors, Various Trades and other internal departments.

https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/881279.name: Strength Coach/Personal Trainer
https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/881279.description:
Age Performance, Salt Lake City, Utah is seeking qualified applicants for an immediate contract position of Strength Coach/Personal Trainer, with potential to work full time quickly for motivated individuals. All applicants must be career-oriented in the field and driven to further educate themselves on and off the job to improve their abilities as a Strength Coach/Personal Trainer. Individual must also be eager to assist with business growth and be devoted to the increase of clients to grow the business.

As a Strength Coach and Personal Trainer for Age Performance you will work with baby boomers and older adults in one-on-one, small group and class settings. Our training philosophies come from the most current and successful functional and movement education based strategies in the aging field. With Age Performance you will have the opportunity to work in a challenging and flexible atmosphere where you must be able to design and implement programs for all clients based on functional and movement based screens and assessments, as well as the client’s goals.

This position has potential to make a very good living for motivated individuals; compensation will be reflective of individual's experience, education and certification level. Unmotivated individuals need not apply.

Job Type: Part-time

Salary: $30,000.00 to $60,000.00 /year

https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/919778.name: Advertising Marketing Manager Consumer Products Division
https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/919778.description:
Job Description

Think bigger than posting a few digital ads. Our Marketing Manager reports to the marketing team daily and with weekly deep dive reports and meetings. This position requires a solid track record of marketing performance is consumer goods and services. 

Only proactive, experienced brand managers and marketing professionals with experience should apply. Only team builders should apply. 

We build awareness of our brands with digital ads, using great shots of products and people using our products, especially video. Campaigns on Google, FB , IG, radio ads, and cable /TV, as well as trade shows are our primary marketing focus. If you have this experience we want to meet you. Please reach out to our team ( Near Riverton and South Jordan ). 

 

Responsibilities

Customer Audience and Segmentation Development

Know your analytics with precision, design and present and execute campaigns with budgets

Complete SEO strategy and execution using competitive tools 

Multiple Social Channels campaigns, segmented with key audience indicators

Create Sales Funnels designed for unique campaigns and measuring analytics

Collaboration between Marketing and Design Departments as well as executives within the company

Create scheduling of marketing and media buy as well as work flow 

Be able to communicate written and in person or digital team calls like ZOOM/SKYPE

The evening shift works like this.....

You board the bus at the office or one of our pick up locations in the valley (departure times in valley are between hours of 5:30 PM and 6:10 PM) you arrive at the Nugget casino at 8:00 PM

5:30 PM to 8:00 PM on duty assisting customers on and off bus

8:00 PM to 1:00 AM (2:00 AM on weekends) you are off duty on layover in Wendover , your time to do what you wish.

1 or 2:00 AM on duty loading returning customers back on bus . On return trips you announce stops as we approach them in SLC , (typically 2 hours after Wendover departure) . Your shift would end when you get off bus at your stop.

Pay is calculated per trip that you host. We pay $60 per trip plus you would receive tips from passengers on the bus, also you do get the Customer perks Coupon book on each trip!

There are many agencies and aggregators to chose from, but Platinum Insurance Group stands apart from the crowd. We have separated ourselves from others because we saw a better way. We have developed a model that offers a 90/10 split on new and renewal business with a max cap that allows you to retain 100% of your commissions above the cap.

You have the option to start producing without a physical location, meaning you can start from home with low to no overhead expenses. Residual income means the harder you work, the more money you make, year after year. Your earning potential has no limit. Most of our agents bring home between $50,000 and $100,000 the first year while having a schedule that fits their life.

Joining with Platinum Insurance Group gives your access to the best insurance companies in the industry, such as Progressive, Nationwide, Allstate, Travelers, Safeco, Liberty Mutual, Met Life and many more. You will be able to offer the best coverages for the best prices, having access to all these carriers and more. You win. Your clients win. For more information, visit PlatinumInsAgents.com.

Liberty Tire Recycling 

The landscape is changing, and Liberty Tire Recycling is at the forefront of a groundbreaking conservation industry. We collect and recycle more than 33% of the nation’s scrap tires, transforming 190 million tires into raw materials for smart, useful products that improve people’s lives. 

We do this because we’re committed to a greener planet. According to the EPA, nearly 300 million scrap tires are generated annually—scrap tires can become a breeding ground for disease-carrying mosquitos and other vermin. Properly reclaiming and recycling these tires into reusable raw materials protects the environment and public health. 

What can Liberty Tire Recycling offer you?

Job Description 

Join our team today! Our CDL Drop and Hook Drivers make between $75,000 and $85,000 per year! Drivers are responsible for the daily collection of tires from multiple customer locations. Average of .68 cents per mile. 

Liberty Tire Recycling 

Liberty Tire Recycling is the premier provider of tire recycling services in the United States. By reclaiming more than 33 percent of the nation’s discarded tires, Liberty Tire annually transforms more than 140 million tires into raw materials for smart, sustainable products that improve people’s lives. With innovative tools, technologies, and processes, Liberty Tire is a revolutionary American conservation enterprise – from coast to coast, and from the whole tire to end product. 

Our Salt Lake City, Utah facility processes an average of 17,000 used tires per day into several types of end-use products. 

What can LTR offer you? 

Along with a competitive salary and excellent work environment, we provide the following benefits: medical, prescription, dental, vision, long and short-term disability, life insurance, accident, matching 401k retirement plan as well as paid vacation and holidays. 

Sign-On Bonus 

· $500 will be paid on the pay period following your 30-day anniversary 

· $1000 will be paid on the pay period following your 90-day anniversary 

· $1000 will be paid on the pay period following your 180-day anniversary 

· $1000 will be paid on the pay period following your one-year anniversary

https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/919774.name: Part Time CNC Operator - Wood Worker
https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/919774.description:
Heber Valley – Part Time Wood Worker/CNC Operator Entrepreneur

If you have solid experience as a CNC operator and quality wood worker/fabricator or cabinet maker, do I have an opportunity for you!

We manufacture modular crack climbing holds for Indoor Climbing Gyms nationwide. [SeeJamwalls.com ]  My two experienced wood-working partners have moved from the area, leaving me on my own to do all the manufacturing – so I need help ASAP!

If you are looking only for a part time opportunity, or are retired and a little bored, check into what I am offering. The beauty of what I can provide is complete flexibility to contract for your hours.  Weekday evenings, weekends, or half-days – no problem.  If you want to work a week and take two off, again no problem.  We can organize production into blocks of time according to your schedule, so long as we are able to build up and maintain the monthly product inventory for our customers. 

What I do now is cut parts 3-4 days per week, and do assembly while the CNC is running.  I have an offsite engineer who handles all the CNC files and programs all changes and design updates, so all you need to do is operate and monitor the machine successfully. We work exclusively with 4’ x 8’ Birch plywood and MDF sheets, with no tool changes necessary for the cuts – you do need to be able to handle the sheets and get them on the table by yourself.

Shop safety is super important and you will need to demonstrate knowledge and practices that convince me you know what you are doing!

Compensation will start $20-$25 per hour depending on your experience, with bonuses for hitting inventory and quality production goals. The right person will be able to make $2,500-$3,000 per month or more working on average 25 hours per week – depending on how efficient you work.  

Our shop is by the Heber Airport.  If all this sounds great to you, please send me an email and/or resume to: drmealing@jamwalls.com.

Tell me about yourself, your work experience, and what you are looking for.  Include your phone number and I will call you to discuss the opportunity in more detail and answer questions.  I look forward to hearing from you!

Company Introduction:

We slice our all-natural* meats and fresh veggies in-house every day. Our fresh-baked bread is made right here where you can see it, and our house-made tuna salad is fresh every day. Jimmy John's Delivery Driver's goal is to get that sandwich in the customer's hand as quick as can be. We do this by learning the most efficient route, double checking orders to ensure everything is accounted for, and hustling on our feet (while always being safe and law abiding while on the street). Drivers take home cash everyday.

- Must be at least 18 years old

- Must have a vehicle, valid driver's license, proof of insurance, and a clean driving record

- Drive safe and obey the rules of the road

- Work as an in-shopper when there are no deliveries

Benefits:

Discounted daily meal

Vision Insurance

Life Insurance

Short Term Disability

$100 Hiring Bonus Available

Seeking GRAVEYARD Certified Nursing Assistants to join our team at Spring Gardens Senior Living (PREVIOUSLY ABBINGTON SENIOR LIVING) in Mapleton, Utah.

**MUST BE WILLING TO WORK GRAVEYARD SHIFT**

Spring Gardens is a premier property that is owned and operated by Avista Senior Living and offers a wide range of benefits to their employees.

Are you looking for something truly different?

At Spring Gardens we believe there is a better way! We strive to deliver excellent resident care by creating an excellent team member experience first.

We are currently seeking an experienced, innovative and caring certified nursing assistants that are committed to excellence to join the Spring Gardens team. Spring Gardens Assisted Living is a premiere senior community that is located in Mapleton, Ut

Why should I choose this role?

Our CNA positions provide excellent hands on experience. In the CNA role you have the responsibility to care and provide assistance with activities of daily living for all residents.. Additionally, the opportunities to grow within the company through the expanding Avista Senior Living Corporation and our Regional Support team are huge!

What support can I expect in order to do my job well?

As a CNA, you are a vital part of the healthcare services at Spring Gardens. If you are looking to further your education we offer flexible schedules and shifts. We use PointClickCare for patient charting, which is a robust and state of the art electronic medical records software.

What qualifications must I have?

A CNA has a passion for working with seniors and a desire to provide the best possible care for seniors. Ideal candidate has expert level of organization and team building skills. Candidate must possess a current CNA license.

Job Type: Full-time

https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/853229.name: Overnight Baker
https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/853229.description:
We are looking for a full-time (or possibly two part-timers if we can make the schedule work) baker to join our team. This is a night shift approximately 10p to 4am, with some flexibility on your start time. Do you enjoy working in a quiet, self-directed environment where you can listen to podcasts and audio books while you bake? Are you a “night owl”? Then this might be the perfect job for you. Some baking experience is great but not required as we are willing to teach and train the right candidate. Please send your resume and/or a cover letter detailing your interest and availability along with relevant work experience, if any.

We are looking for a long-term Baker to prepare our plant-based pastries, primarily donuts and become part of our work family. Baker responsibilities include working overnight preparing and frying dough, preparing fillings and glazing pastries.

This is a good job for a self-starter as you are largely unsupervised. We need someone SUPER reliable who does not mind working solo. Ask yourself if you are someone who almost never misses work because that's what we need.

We are a small operation. If the baker doesn't show up, then we have to close our business the next day, which is hard on customers. We can arrange time off with an advance request. But this is not a job where it works to call out on short notice. Please do not apply if you do not consider yourself to be unusually reliable and dependable with showing up for your shift.

If you are someone who is looking for long-term employment, likes being self-directed, enjoys working alone and being able to listen to podcasts while you work, then you might be a great fit. We prefer some baking experience, but are willing to train someone who is a dedicated worker looking for a long-term position.

Responsibilities

- Work alone to prepare and make pastries

- Clean kitchen equipment and tools before use

- Weigh flour and other ingredients to prepare dough

- Adjust oil temperatures to ensure proper baking

- Mix various ingredients to create fillings

- Decorate doughnuts with glazes, icings and edible toppings

- Shape dough to prepare different types of pastries, including sweet rolls

- Recommend recipes to renew our menu and attract more customers (e.g. gluten-free or vegan desserts)

- Track food supplies and help place orders, as needed

Preferred Skills (but not required, will train):

- Experience as a Baker, Pastry Chef or similar role

- Familiarity with all professional kitchen equipment, including mixers, blenders and dough sheeters

- Understanding of food safety practices

- Experience with cake decoration techniques

- Certification from a culinary school is a plus

Required Skills

- Excellent time-management skills

- Ability to remain calm and focused in a fast-paced environment

- Team spirit, with a customer-focused attitude

- Flexibility to work in late evening or early morning shifts

- Reliable, honest and dependable

COVID-19 precautions

- Social distancing guidelines in place

- Sanitizing, disinfecting, or cleaning procedures in place

You will be able to work isolated with very little direct contact from any other employee or customers.

https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/919348.name: Medical Assistant
https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/919348.description:
Medical Assistant

 

Requisition Number: S00748P: Student Health Center

 

Position Category: Staff

 

Campus Location: Weber State University - Ogden, UT

 

Hours Per Week: 35

 

Months Per Year: 12

  

Pay Grade: N26

 

FLSA: Non-Exempt

 

Job Summary/Basic Function:

 

Position provides direct patient care and other services in a small campus health center. Duties include but are not limited to: rooming patients, taking vital signs, interfacing with EMR, preparing patients for exams/procedures, providing immunizations and phlebotomy services, performing basic lab procedures and processing, cleaning/ preparing and maintaining instruments and exam rooms, monitoring and ordering supply inventory, assisting providers, and covering the front desk as needed.

 

Required Qualifications:

 

Completion of accredited Medical Assisting program.

 

Current Medical Assisting credential.

 

Current BLS/CPR certification.

 

One year of full-time related work experience in outpatient clinic settings with adult patients, including collection and testing of lab specimens.

 

Basic computer skills and proficiency with data entry

 

Preferred Qualifications:

 

Seeking applicants with:

Strong interpersonal skills.

 

Experience with laboratory labeling, EMR documentation, and online ordering/purchasing of medical supplies.

 

Demonstrated ability to interact respectfully with diverse patients and collaborate effectively with medical and administrative professionals.

 

Ability to adhere firmly to confidentiality standards required in medical settings.

 

Preferred qualifications include:

Two years of related work experience in outpatient clinic settings with adult patients, including phlebotomy and lab.

 

Phlebotomy certification.

 

Bilingual Spanish or Chinese.

 

Background Check? Yes

 

Benefits Summary:

 

WSU offers a generous benefits package that includes medical, dental, long-term disability, life insurance, retirement, a wellness program with release time and paid incentives, tuition benefits, free tickets to athletic and performing arts events, and paid holidays, vacation, and sick leave.

 

Job Open Date: 04/02/2021

 

Review Date: 04/12/2021

  

Open Until Filled: Yes

 

Notes to Applicant:

 

To apply, please complete the online application and attach a cover letter, current resume, evidence of the required credentials/certifications, and the names and contact information for three professional references.

 

Screening of applications will begin April 12, 2021. Position will remain open until filled.

 

Criminal background check required as a condition of employment.

 

Physical Activity of this position: Standing. Particularly for sustained periods of time. , Moving about to accomplish tasks, particularly for long distances or moving from one work site to another., Operate, activate, use, prepare, inspect, place, detect, or position. , Grasping. Applying pressure to an object with the fingers and palm. , Feeling. Perceiving attributes of objects, such as size, shape, temperature or texture by touching with skin, particularly that of fingertips. , Expressing or exchanging ideas. Those activities in which they must convey detailed or important instructions to other workers accurately or quickly. , Ability to receive detailed information with or without assistance., Repetitive motion. Substantial movements (motions) of the wrists, hands, and/or fingers.

 

Physical Requirements of this position: Light work. Exerting up to 20 lbs of force occasionally and/or up to 10 lbs of force frequently and/or a negligible amount of force constantly to move objects. Use of arm and/or leg controls exerting forces greater than that for sedentary work.

 

Visual Acuity Requirements including color, depth perception and field of vision: Required to perform activities such as preparing and analyzing data and figures; transcribing; using a computer terminal; extensive reading.

 

The conditions the worker will be subject to in this position: None. The worker is not substantially exposed to adverse environmental conditions (such as in typical office or administrative work).

 

To apply, visit https://apptrkr.com/2212043

https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/833415.name: Sales Rep / Weekly Pay + Love Your Job again!
https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/833415.description:
Marquee IT, one of the fastest growing companies in Utah county, is now hiring Inbound Sales Reps for our Orem location. If you are honest, hardworking , have sales ability and phone skills, then come join our amazing sales floor!

Pay and Hours:

$12 an hr + Commissions starting pay (average hourly pay $15-$25 an hour)

Part-time shifts and Full-time shifts available

Hours between 8:00 am - 6:00 pm

﻿Schedule an Interview:

Text Ren at 801-341-9603

No Experience Required

We will train you to succeed!

Most employees are making $16+ an hour after their first couple weeks, Talented hardworking people can make $20+ their very first week on the phone and do that consistently every single week. Always guaranteed MIN $12 an hour + commission opportunities every single week.

What You'll Do:

Our customers will fill out a contact form on our website because they are having some sort of computer problem. You job will be to call them and and assist them over the phone and through our remote computer connection. You will be able to see and control their computer though our remote connection so that you are better able to assist and give them recommendations for one of our tech support plans that they can purchase. If they choose to buy our service our trained technicians will take over from there. Most calls last 15-20 minutes and most of our customer are very friendly and happy to have our help. It's rewarding important service you will be providing.

Benefits:

available within 90 days

Company Incentives:

-Best Leads in the industry

-No Cold calling! -Training provided

-Earn Free lunch every Friday

-WEEKLY PAYCHECKS

-Daily, weekly, and monthly Cash spiffs and Prizes !

-Fun environment with daily games and competitions

-Our team leads have years of experience to give you the right tools to make sure you succeed

-Two Xbox lounge area

-Fun, high energy, and positive environment, Lounge area with ping-pong

-Referral bonuses - earn $$$$ for every person you bring in that stays 30 days!

-Company Parties, Pizza, BBQ's and donuts

-Casual Dress Code

-Opportunities for advancement

https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/919324.name: Delivery Driver delivering Amazon Packages
https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/919324.description:
Job Description

We are hiring! Come join our amazing team and deliver thousands of smiles to Happy Customers!

Bethco Solutions is hiring Delivery Drivers to deliver Amazon packages out of our new American Fork facility.

No CDL required!

Full Time and Part-Time positions available

Approximate hours are 10 AM to 8 PM. Shifts range between 8-10 hours per day and are available 7 days per week.

Full Time: 3 - 4 days per week (8-10 hr. shifts)

Part Time: 2 - 3 days per week (8-10 hr. shifts)

Weekend only shifts available

Benefits

- $15/hr.

- Paid Training

- Health Insurance and Benefits

- Paid Time Off

- Safe Driving Incentives

- Referral Incentives

We are looking for motivated individuals to be part of our amazing team!

Responsibilities

- Deliver Amazon packages safely and in a timely manner

- Use a hand held device for routing information and customer delivery information

- Comfortable driving and working in varying weather conditions.

Requirements

- Great attitude and work ethic

- Independent problem solver who is passionate about customer service

- At least 21 years of age

- Valid driver's license in state of residence

- Valid work authorization (Work Visa, Green Card, US Citizenship)

- Must have good driving record

- Consent to a Pre-employment Drug Screen

- Willing to work some weekends

- Busy active job that requires light lifting and getting in and out of vans during your shift

Attendance, punctuality, and the ability to complete the entirety of a scheduled shift is a critical job function as a Delivery Associate for Bethco Solutions.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment regardless of age, national origin, race, color, disability, religious beliefs, or sexual orientation

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Pay: $15.00 - $16.00 per hour

https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/879244.name: DAY TRADE OUR MONEY - CORP. FUND MANAGER - NO INCOME CAP (Work From Home)
https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/879244.description:
Are you coachable and teachable enough to qualify to Trade OUR money in the Financial Markets? We mainly trade in the Foreign Exchange Market (Forex) and the Cryptocurrency Market and we’ll share with you why! WE take the risk and YOU keep 50% to 80% of the profits. We’re a 10 year old company with thousands of traders/members worldwide. You don’t punch a time clock with us! Many of our traders only trade 1 or 2 hours a day, on their schedule, in the comfort of their home or office.

We will show you our trading tools in action. Most importantly, we will allow you to TRY OUR TRADING TOOLS for a full 30 days, so you can experience it for yourself and qualify to trade our money!

Have you ever wanted to learn to day trade but,

1) You don’t know how to start

2) You lack the capital to invest

3) You thought trading was too risky

If so, you are certainly not alone. Most people cite these reasons for not attempting it.

We solved these issues by doing what NO ONE ELSE WOULD DO!

1) We will teach you, step-by-step, with an EXPERIENCED, SUCCESSFUL personal coach, trading with you and using our proprietary PREDICTIVE indicators. So, you will know exactly how to profitably trade with CONFIDENCE.

2) Once you are trained and qualified, we will FUND AN ACCOUNT FOR YOU WITH OUR COMPANY FUNDS, up to $100,000 over time based on performance, so the income potential is exceptional!

3) We take ALL the risk. Even so, when you are profitable, YOU keep 50% to 80% of the profits. If you lose money (and practically everyone loses some as they are learning), you lose OUR money (which, by the way, you NEVER have to pay back). Naturally, since we both are interested in your success, we work hard to ensure that you don’t lose money, but are consistently profitable. 

Some may ask — “Why would your company do this?”

The reasons are simple: We have been doing this for years and have trained 1,000’s of individuals, from a wide range of backgrounds, to trade our system.

Finally, any experienced trader will tell you that one of the most critical aspects of trading is dealing with the FEAR & EMOTIONS of trading your own money, meaning, most traders can be successful “practice” trading (without real money) but, once they start trading with their own real money at risk, it’s a “whole different ball game”, which the vast majority of people cannot handle — and they end up losing their money and quitting.

But, when they trade OUR money, the pressure is off and they can trade with much the same calmness and confidence as when they were practice trading. As they trade with our money, they keep most of the profits and we keep the lesser portion.

So, we have created a WIN-WIN scenario for everyone involved.

We have had great success with our traders, but we have LIMITED spots available.

Again, our traders come from virtually all backgrounds, so it really comes down to "first come -- first-placed".

Time is of the essence, so fill out the application and we will be in touch with you.

This is not in any way an offer or solicitation for you to buy or sell any securities to or from us. All trading is done on dummy accounts to learn how to trade or done in the accounts of others who give you permission to make trades in their accounts, and not with your own money. We are not licensed to offer or purchase securities, and thus do not offer or solicit the sale or purchase of securities by you from us. This is not a get-rich-quick program or business opportunity. We provide training and trading tools. We make no promises that our training and tools will generate future income for students, and you may not make your investment back.

https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/919315.name: Guide (Therapy, Social Work, Psychology)
https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/919315.description:
ROOTs Transition, located in Park City, Utah, serves females 14-18 years old who have attachment, relational and/or developmental trauma utilizing a hybrid model of outdoor reflection and residential integration. We are a small community of individuals dedicated to providing intentional programming with a trauma informed approach. Reclaiming Our Original Truths (ROOTs) serves as a guiding principle for our students in their healing process.

As a guide at ROOTs, you will impact the lives of our students by building relationships through meaningful conversations, shared experiences, and acting as a role model. Our guides often describe their position as both challenging and rewarding. Guides participate work closely with licensed clinical therapists to facilitate therapeutic treatment plans. This is a great opportunity to make an impact while acquiring practical experience in the field of social work and psychology.

You will be assigned to a smaller team of staff who work closely together to provide support, training, and guidance in working with our students. At ROOTs, we value community. Guides are invited to choose a specialty outside of their regular duties with the intention of creating ownership and developing a sense of purpose within their role. At ROOTs, our investment in personal growth expands to our entire community. Our training programs will support you in your development and allow for mobility within our company.

This job is for you, if:

- You are open to feedback and personal growth

- You can be actively involved in the supervision and safety of our students

- You can demonstrate compassion during challenging interactions with students

- You can exercise good judgment and personal boundaries

- You can be a positive role model

- You are interested in learning more about a trauma informed approach

Qualifications and Skills:

- Must be 21 years old

- Background in family studies/social work/psychology (preferred, but not required)

- Experience working with adolescent females (preferred, but not required)

- Customer service oriented

- Strong verbal and written communication skills

- Strong organizational skills

- Willing to work weekends and holidays

- Strong work ethic

- Valid driver’s license

- Able to pass a background check and drug screening

Salary: Starting pay range $15 (depending on experience and education)

Job Type:

Full or part-time position available

- Weekend shifts required

Benefits (for full time employees):

- Health insurance

- Dental insurance

- Vision insurance

- Paid time off

- Referral bonus

Website: www.rootstransition.com

Email resume to kami@rootstransition.com

https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/787260.name: Landscape Supervisors and Laborers
https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/787260.description:
At Peak Landscapes we strive for a fun and hard working work environment and we are dedicated to providing the best experience for our customers. We are looking for people to join our team and help us achieve those two goals. We are currently accepting applications for various positions within the company and are looking for good attitude and a good work ethic. So if you have those, whether you have 10 years experience or none, we want you.

The Crew Supervisor:

Will be required to manage a crew of 2-4 employees, including keeping work on schedule, employees on task, equipment clean and in good working order, and ensuring quality service is rendered and a positive experience for our customers. Positions are seasonal, but Salary/Full time positions will be available for those who show exceptional dedication and abilities.

Requirements for Crew Supervisor position:

---Valid Driver's license with good driving history (CDL is a plus)

---Bilingual (English and Spanish) is a huge plus

---18 years old or older

---40-50 hour work weeks

---Able to lift 100 pounds and be on feet all day

---Able to work outdoors and perform physical labor

---Able to perform all the duties of the Labor/Installer position as well

---2 years experience minimum

---Must be able to operate a skid steer and a mini excavator and pull heavy trailers

---Some mechanical experience is a plus

---Pays $20-$35/hour depending on experience and ability to perform the required tasks

Labor/installers:

Will be expected to be able to shovel, rake, install irrigation systems, install sod. Show up on time to work. Show Integrity and professionalism in all aspects of the work. Must get a long well with others. Positions are seasonal, but Salary/Full time positions will be available for those who show exceptional dedication and abilities

Requirements for Labor/installer position:

---18 years old or older

---No experience required

---Valid driver's license with good driving record

---Physically able to perform the work, including heavy lifting, standing on your feet all day, and being able to hustle

---Being able to perform the duties described above.

---Show up on time for work (typical hours vary between 7 AM to 5PM)

---Have your own mode of transportation to and from Spanish Fork

---Keep equipment clean and in good working order

---Learn fast

---Pays $15-$20 per hour depending on your experience and ability to perform the required tasks

No matter what position you apply for, if you are honest and show dedication and abilities to perform the work in an exceptional manner we will take care of you and will compensate you accordingly.

Please use the links provided to apply or send us an email to resumes@peaklandscapes.net. Call Jeff at 801-592-8997 for more information.

https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/919284.name: Spring/Wire Machine Operator
https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/919284.description:
Operator needed for Utah’s only custom spring & wire form manufacturer. Spring/wire machines are designed specifically to produce springs such as compression, extension, and torsion springs. Wire Forming equipment is used to form wire into a variety of shapes and sizes. Both types typically use a process to uncoil raw wire material from a spool and run it through a series of wheels to straighten the wire before it is formed into shapes or made into coiled springs.

Operators and assistants are responsible for set-ups, tool change-outs, and machine inputs to program the sequence of operations, etc. The company uses state of the art industry-specific equipment and has multiple machines at its location in Woods Cross. To view a short video of machines in action go to: https://www.youtube.com/user/springworksutah/videos.

https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/893196.name: Psych Tech (Full-time and Part time)
https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/893196.description:
Acqua Recovery is a Joint Commission Accredited, 20-bed residential drug, alcohol, and mental health treatment center, located on the grounds of a 125-year-old estate in Midway, Utah. This beautiful setting and supportive atmosphere will help build a foundation for sobriety and healing. 

Job Description

First and foremost, you will be responsible for doing your part to help build and maintain a world-class addiction recovery facility.

 • Our Psych Tech's aid in basic care of our residents. 

Position involves coordinating residential activities and providing help with general needs of residents. 

• Techs assist in group therapy, resident education, and continuous monitoring of residents to maintain a safe environment and ensure safety of residents at all times. 

• Escort residents to activities and help transport to and from substance abuse meetings.

• Uphold rules and regulations of the Acqua Recovery's program, maintains resident accountability and assists in establishing healthy boundaries that facilitate responsibility and growth. 

• Assist nursing staff with dispensing medications, obtaining accurate vital signs and documenting information appropriately, completes rounds, and documents findings accurately and timely. 

• Recognize and report changes in resident’s affect, behavior, and/or mood.   

• Monitor and record resident’s progress to ensure that goals and objectives are met

• Report status of residents to Supervisor and perform all charting as directed.

• Responsible for managing facility duties as directed by Supervisor

• May be asked to perform other duties as assigned, in alignment with your experience and scope of practice.

Skills:

• Social Perceptiveness – being aware of others’ reactions and understanding why they react as they do

At Acqua, we invest in our front line staff with education, trainings, and growth. All of our techs are trained as Certified Recovery Coaches.

Education and Experience:

High School Diploma, strong interpersonal skills, valid driver’s license, at least one year of sobriety, and must pass background check.   Willingness to familiarize self with Phase Work and 12-Steps.

Experience in residential and/or mental health preferred.

https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/911131.name: Pipelayer/Laborer
https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/911131.description:
Position Overview

The General Laborer is responsible for safely performing a variety of construction duties to assist the highway, utility, grade crews or at various on-site plant locations. This position involves various manual tasks. Work will be performed per the supervisor's instruc­tion, free from direct supervision except for more complicated jobs. 

Key Responsibilities (Essential Duties and Functions)

Highway Laborer:

- Prepares ground surfaces for the road building process. Removes debris out of the construction path.

- Operates ground compactors, levels out and rakes dirt, sets string markers, and removes items within the area to be paved.

- Sets up fencing, barricades, and/or safety cones to block off the work area as needed.

- Prepares manhole covers, openings and water lines. May insert risers as needed.

- Walks behind paver machine to shovel and rake asphalt as it is applied to the ground. Levels out asphalt with rake and uses shovel to dig out manhole covers and water valve boxes that are buried by the asphalt.

- Cleans asphalt off tools and equipment after each work day.

- May assist with operating equipment as needed and if trained, including paver, roller, backhoe, water truck, etc.

- Performs other laborer tasks as needed to include cutting concrete or asphalt with saw, sweeping, etc.

Utility Laborer:

- Hand shovels to prepare ground trenches for pipes and utility lines. May dig up existing pipes and lines. Pipes include water, sewer, conduit and other utility lines.

- Attaches trench box and pipes to chains or guide wires to be lifted and moved by         the heavy equipment operator. Installs shoring materials.

- Guides pipes into place while equipment operator maneuvers pipe on chains/wires.  Connects pipes using tools, lubricants, glue, grout, etc. Builds couplings,    

- connectors, and mechanical joints using various tools and parts. Cuts pipe to size.

- Sets up and operates laser level tripod and pipe lasers.

- May operate equipment as needed if trained, including front end loader, excavator, backhoe, skidsteer and other construction equipment. 

Grade Laborer:

- Hand shovels and rakes to perform groundwork.

- May cut concrete with saw as needed to finish grades.

- Removes and replaces sewer/manhole/sump castings and covers in the ground.

- Assists the Grader with grading tasks as needed.

- Performs other laborer duties as required.         

- May operate equipment as needed if trained, including skidsteer and other equipment. 

Crusher Laborer:

- Performs machinery maintenance and repairs. 

- Unplugs and shovels off conveyors and screens.

- Changes out screens, rollers, cone liners, etc.

- Repairs conveyor problems. Greases moving machine parts.

- Performs crusher machinery set up and take down which includes running cables and hoses, setting up blocks, assembling/disassembling machinery, operating skidsteer to move parts, tarping, shoveling aggregate, etc.

- Keeps crusher machinery area clean of debris and shovels aggregate.

- Operates equipment to include skidsteer (and loader if trained).

- Moves excess materials from around the crusher machinery.

Plant laborer:

- Participates in daily THINK/TRACK meetings plus weekly safety meetings.

- Assists in plant production of materials and ensures for the efficient working condition of the plant.

- Stockpiles materials and feeds hot plant from the stockpiles in an efficient and productive manner.

- Ensures that all assigned equipment is properly maintained, clean, in safe working order and operated properly.     

- Prepares plant for operations at the beginning of the season, and performs shut down procedures at the end of the season. 

- Operates front end loader, skidsteer, end dump truck and other heavy equipment as needed.

- Performs plant maintenance and repairs, including welding tasks.

- Performs set up and take down of traveling plants at different job site locations as required.

           

Other Duties:

- Uses various equipment, hand and power tools.

- Picks up and/or delivers construction materials at job site locations. 

- Performs job site clean-up.

- Assists with flagging and traffic control as needed.

- Maintains all tools and equipment in a safe and clean condition.

- Other duties as assigned per supervisor

Qualifications

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skills, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disability to perform the essential functions.

Education/Experience

- High school diploma or general education degree (GED) preferred.

- Previous related experience in the construction field is a plus.

-

- Work Requirements

- Ability to read and comprehend instructions, short correspondence, and memos. 

- Ability to write correspondences and memos. 

- Ability to add, subtract, multiply, and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals.

- Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out detailed, but uninvolved written or oral instructions.

- Ability to work well with others in a group or one on one setting.

- To perform this job successfully, an individual should have knowledge of Inventory and Order processing systems; uses job specific computer system for ticketing and two way radio for communications.

- May be subject to drug testing, and physical agilities testing.

Knowledge/Skill Requirements

- Must have a current and valid driver’s license. 

- 1 year of experience working on excavation sites and have experience laying water, sewer & storm drain preferred

Key Competencies

- Customer Service - Manages difficult or emotional employee situations; Responds promptly to employee needs; Responds to requests for service and assistance; Meets commitments.

- Teamwork - Contributes to building a positive team spirit.

- Judgment - Exhibits sound and accurate judgment.

- Planning/Organizing - Uses time efficiently.

- Professionalism - Approaches others in a tactful manner; Reacts well under pressure; Accepts responsibility for own actions.

- Interpersonal Skills - Focuses on solving conflict, not blaming; Maintains confidentiality; Listens to others without interrupting; Keeps emotions under control; Remains open to others' ideas and tries new things.

- Safety and Security - Observes safety and security procedures; Determines appropriate action beyond guidelines; Reports potentially unsafe conditions; Uses equipment and materials properly.

- Adaptability - Adapts to changes in the work environment; Changes approach or method to best fit the situation; Able to deal with frequent change, delays, or unexpected events.

- Attendance/Punctuality - Is consistently at work and on time.

- Dependability - Follows instructions, responds to management direction; Commits to long hours of work when necessary to reach goals.

- Initiative - Asks for and offers help when needed.

- Innovation - Generates suggestions for improving work.

- Quality - Demonstrates accuracy and thoroughness; Looks for ways to improve and promote quality; Applies feedback to improve performance

- Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out detailed, but uninvolved written or oral instructions.

Physical Requirements

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

The employee is frequently required to sit, climb, and use hands to signal and handle equipment. The employee is occasionally required to stand, walk, crawl, kneel, bend, and reach with hands and arms above their shoulders. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move anywhere up to 50-75 lbs. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision and depth perception.

Work Environment

The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is occasionally exposed to wet and/or humid conditions; moving mechanical parts; outside weather conditions; and extreme cold and/or heat. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate to loud.

The statements included in this job description are not intended to be all-inclusive. They represent typical elements and criteria necessary to successfully perform the job. Other duties may be assigned as required. Requirements for this job are subject to modification by the Company and its designees, and reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/864804.name: EXPERIENCED PLUMBER/DRAIN CLEANER
https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/864804.description:
WE WANT YOU!!!

Are you an Experienced Plumber who wants to work for a thriving company where you can grow, be recognized, and be rewarded for your work?

If you’re a clock-puncher who wants to do as little as possible then please stop reading this right now. This job is not for you.

BUT if you want to....

Come work with friends in an environment that rewards you for your hard work and provides a life-long career, then apply NOW!

We don’t want to be a pit stop in your career – we want to be the last job you’ll ever have (because you can’t imagine working anywhere else)

Every Day Is Amazing

You show up early for your shift because you can’t wait to hang out with the other members of your team. (You’d NEVER do this at your old job but this is a tight-knit group and you love hanging out with them).

You work hard because everyone else on your team works hard too. You push yourself today, and every day, because you know that growing in your own position ensures a career for life… and there’s a ton of prizes to be won.

At the end of the day, you wrap up the last few tasks and hang out with your friends for a few minutes again before heading home. Or maybe some of you hang out in off-work hours.

As you drive home, you reflect that this place is unlike any other job you’ve had before, and you can’t wait to get back to this team again tomorrow.

Does this sound like a place you’d like to spend your day?

·        If you work at a job you can barely tolerate…

·        If you work at a job that doesn’t respect you…

·        If you work at a job that fills you with dread the night before

·        And if you want to wake up in the morning because you CAN’T WAIT to get to work to see your friends and to push yourself to be more successful, and even to make a lot of money…

Then we want to talk to you.

We’re looking for team members who are starving to push themselves beyond their personal limits, to earn the money and recognition they deserve, and to have an amazing life-long career in an environment where you work with friends every day.

What’s So Different Here?

Our target is simple: to become THE place that every hungry plumber WANTS to work!

Here are just a few of the reasons why our team members LOVE working here…

  *Make more money: pay based on experience (spiffs and commission on all sales)

*Health Benefits

*Celebrated Birthdays

*Paid training

*Paid holidays and vacations (Paid time off starts after 90 days and grows from there)

*Paid Wellness Days

*Incentive programs

* 401(k)

*Profit-Sharing Program

*Company training/breakfasts

*Paid uniform

*Company Vehicle

Here at Craig's, we have a clearly laid out path to build the life-long career you've always wanted to build (including paid education and tons of opportunities to advance)

 We have built the strongest team and culture you’ve ever seen, where team members are deeply motivated; we care about you and your hobbies and your family and your free time and make sure that can have that balance in your life to enjoy it all; we’re constantly expanding and creating amazing new opportunities for you. We want to help you dream big in your life and career… and we want to help you achieve it all.

 Who Are We? We’re Craig’s Services. We started over 52 years ago. Over the years we built, expanded, and grew. We are dominating the Davis County Area. We help others, too – we’re strong supporters of various charities providing financial contributions as well as conducting food and clothing drives. We currently started a virtual reality training center to provide our employees with hands on training to stay up to date with the industry.

... and it feels like we’re only getting started! We are adding more team members, and you should see the plans we have for growth beyond this!

Are You A Fit?

 Never look for a job again because we’re not a pit stop in your career – we’re the last place you’ll ever work!

 If you’re a hard-working professional with an inner drive to improve yourself and help others then you might be a fit for us…

 Along with the job-specific qualifications (below) here are the qualities we’re looking for in our perfect candidate:

 ·        You work hard

·        You love working with a team

·        You’re tech savvy – you can diagnose a problem and make recommendations to fix it

·        You love to serve others

·        You love to challenge yourself and you want to learn, and even be cross-trained

·        You understand the importance of serving others (your team members and our customers)

 Job Duties:

 Work with the team: You stay in contact with your supervisor and your team to make sure the work orders are completed efficiently – everyone pitches in because it’s ultimately about serving the customer.

 Develop your expertise: You install and repair plumbing systems. You are a drain cleaning expert knowing that you’re ultimately helping people live comfortable and safer lives. Over time, you gain a growing expertise at diagnosing problems and understanding how to repair or replace them. You respond to emergencies with safety as your top priority.

 Become a trusted professional: You keep your tools neat, clean, and well-maintained so they’re handy and ready for use and safe. You’ll learn to prepare written materials (e.g. scope of work, work orders, bids, equipment inventory, etc.) because you know that this keeps everyone informed – from the customer to the journeyman to the team back at the office. You look forward to the day when you’re a trusted industry expert with your own apprentices to train.

 Job Requirements:

 You love to learn: You have a high school diploma or equivalent. Most importantly, you have a drive to learn more because you know that it serves everyone – from the customer to the team to yourself. You eagerly complete your apprenticeship requirements and ask, “What’s next?” You’re even willing to be cross-trained in other trades.

 You’re a tech-savvy people-person: You love the puzzle and adventure of understanding and completing the technical challenges you’re posed with every day. At the same time, you’re comfortable talking to a homeowner and professionally educating them on what their options are. Equipment handling, technical information, simple math and geometry? No problem.

 You’re ready to work: You have a driver’s license, a ready-to-work attitude, and no problem handling the physical demands of the job – such as lifting heavy equipment or balancing on a ladder. You’re capable of working in enclosed spaces or doing a significant amount of crawling and standing. (Hey, if this is a surprise to you then you probably shouldn’t be a plumber).

 You’re a professional: You are clean, neat, and well-groomed in appearance and you understand that safety is paramount. You won’t work anywhere that is unsafe but you know safety is a two-way street, so you won’t do anything unsafe either.

 Now Is Your Time! What are you waiting for? We can’t wait for you to be a part of our TEAM!

Recursion is a digital biology company industrializing drug discovery. We are working to solve some of the hardest, most meaningful problems facing human health today. Come join us in our mission to decode biology to radically improve lives, while doing the most impactful work of your life. 

The Impact You’ll Make

https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/919257.description:
Primary Responsibilities:

 The Service Department Lot Attendant is expected to:

 Protect the legal, financial and moral wellbeing of the Larry H. Miller Dealerships'.

 Exceed customer expectations with courteous communications while maintain efficient traffic flow to ensure timely processes.

 Seek ways to improve business operation efficiencies and customer service.

 Be a teacher to support the efforts of other employees to be successful.

 Essential Job Functions:

 * Ensure Maximum Production and Customer Service.

 * Pick up and/or deliver vehicles as required.

 * Check-in vehicles noting vin number, mileage, license, fuel level and assess for damage.

 * Effectively communication with Technicians and management to ensure the operation is appropriately cleaned, organized and safe, including service lot while ad hearing to all OSHA/EPA requirements.

 * Ensure proper placement of all vehicles for organization and safety. All vehicles should be properly secured and locked prior to close of businesses.

 * Act as a backup person for the dealership Shuttle Driver.

 * Maintain employee, customer and vendor confidence while protecting operations by exercising discretion when handling sensitive confidential information.

 * Complete and maintain all Larry H. Miller Dealerships' required training.

 * Maintain ability to handle job stress and effective interaction with others in the workplace.

 * Perform all other job duties as requested by management.

 * Operate with Integrity

 * Demand the highest ethical standards from self and others.

 Maintain composure within the workplace as well as outside the workplace when interacting or representing the Larry H. Miller Dealerships'.

 * Set an example of positive attitude and professionalism, including a neat, orderly and safe work environment.

 Minimum Qualifications:

 Must be 18 years of age or older to qualify for this position.

 * Education

 * High school diploma or the equivalent.

 * Certifications

 * Maintain valid driver's license and MVR record within company policy requirements.

 * If providing shuttle services with customers an annual Fitness for Duty evaluation by employer's medical provider is required.

 * Skills

 * Active Learning- Understanding the implications of new information for both current and future problem-solving and decision-making.

 * Learning Strategies- Selecting and using training/instructional methods and procedures appropriate for the situation when learning or teaching new things.

 * Communication- Basic ability to read and write, ability to effectively convey information to others, apply active listening by taking the time to understand the points being made by employees and customers, being aware of other's reactions and understanding why they react as they do.

 * Social Perceptiveness- Being aware of others' reactions and understanding why they react as they do.

 * Critical thinking- Using logic and reasoning to identify the strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions, conclusions or approaches to problems.

 * Knowledge

 * Knowledge of Larry H. Miller Dealerships' current company management systems desirable.

 * Interacting with Computers- Using computers and computer systems (including hardware and software) to program, write software, set up functions, enter data, or process information. Knowledge of Microsoft Office products is required.

 * English Language- Knowledge of the structure and content of the English language including the meaning and spelling of words, rules of composition, and grammar. Ability to understand written sentences and paragraphs in work related documents.

 * Customer and Personal Service- Knowledge of principles and process for providing customer and personal services. This includes customer needs assessment, meeting quality standards for services, and evaluation of customer satisfaction.

 * Hazardous Materials- General knowledge of proper procedures and safety measures for handling items that may contain hazardous materials.

 General Standards:

 To perform the job successfully, an individual should demonstrate the following competencies:

 Active Listening- Giving full attention to what other people are saying, taking time to understand the points being made, asking questions as appropriate, and not interrupting at inappropriate times.

 Adaptability- Ability to adapt to changes in the work environment, manages competing demands and is able to deal with frequent change, delays or unexpected events.

 Selective Attention- Concentrate on a task over a period of time without being distracted.

 Making Decisions and Solving Problems- Analyzing information and evaluating results to choose the best solution and solve problems.

 Interpersonal Skills- Maintains confidentiality, remains open to others' ideas and exhibits willingness to try new things.

 Leadership- Ability to lead, take charge, and offer opinions and direction while setting an example of ethical practices for all employees.

 Compliance- Understanding of and adherence to all Company standards, state and federal laws and regulations as well as product pricing guidelines of all lenders, agencies or business partners.

 Customer Service- Providing excellent customer service through the defined Larry H. Miller processes which promote efficiencies, fairness and cost effectiveness.

 Ethics/Integrity- Representing the Larry H. Miller Dealerships' by conducting yourself in a professional and courteous manner that demonstrates integrity and avoiding actual or perceived conflicts of interest. Complying with company standards and business ethics.

 Oral Communication- Clearly identifying and professionally expressing issues in positive or negative situations.

 Planning/Organizing- Prioritizing and planning work activities and using time effectively.

 Quality- Demonstrating accuracy and thoroughness and monitoring your work to ensure quality.

 Dependability- Consistent, punctual attendance at work; following instructions; responding to management direction; and soliciting feedback to improve performance.

 Time management- The ability to integrate methods of time management to provide a consistent and effective workflow that is cohesive for the department and team.

 Safety and Security- Observing safety and security procedures and using equipment and materials properly.

 Company management reserves the right to add to, change or retract portions of this job description. Employee is required to adhere to the qualifications, duties and conditions of any revised job description.

 Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled

https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/919261.description:
DESCRIPTION

Job Title: Wellness Advisor

Reports to: General Manager

COMPANY OVERVIEW:

YogaSix believes everyone deserves the mind-body experience of yoga. YogaSix offers six different class types designed to accommodate students of all levels in a way that is empowering, encouraging and fun. YogaSix is the fastest growing boutique yoga company in the United States. We are looking for dynamic, customer-service driven team members for both our Fort Union & Sugarhouse locations.

POSITION:

The Wellness Advisor assists the General Manager with new membership sales as well the retention of current members. The Wellness Advisor provides superior customer service while assisting new and current students in class selections, answering membership questions, posting on social media, performing grassroots marketing, and transacting merchandise purchases. We expect you to be excited about meeting and greeting our customers and be part of building a strong YogaSix community. The Wellness Advisor also assists with studio cleanliness and daily operations.

JOB REQUIREMENTS:

- Excellent sales, communication and customer service skills

- Goal-oriented with an ability to achieve sales targets

- Strong in-person customer service skills

- Ability to learn and use the Club Ready software system

- Must be fluent in English and have excellent communication skills in person, and via phone/text/email

- Must have proficient computer skills

- Attend special events and trainings as needed

- Part-time with flexibility (must be available early mornings, evenings, and weekends - at least two of three)

- Social media proficiency highly desired

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS

- May be required to sit or stand for up to five hours at a time. May be required to reach with hands and arms. Must be able to bend, lift, kneel and drive a car. This job requires the person to climb up and down flights of stairs as elevators are not present at all locations. May be asked to occasionally lift up to 30 pounds

- Specific vision abilities required by this job include Close vision, Distance vision, Peripheral vision, Depth perception and the ability to adjust and focus

- Must be able to effectively hear in person and via telephone

- Must be able to stand during working hours

COMPENSATION & PERKS:

- This position offers a competitive hourly wage based on experience

- Opportunity for bonus based on performance and team goals

- Opportunity for growth within the studios including additional sales and management positions

- FREE yoga!

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $10.00 to $12.00 per hour, plus bonus/commission opportunities

Application Question:

- Please let us know your ideal shift hours

- Please let us know your experience with yoga and/or fitness

The YogaSix Utah culture can be described as:

- Team-oriented -- cooperative and collaborative

- Outcome-oriented -- results-focused with strong performance culture

- Empowered -- our teachers and staff have a great deal of latitude to do what is right for our members

Company's website:

- www.yogasix.com/sugarhouse

- www.yogasix.com/fortunion

https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/919254.description:
Primary Responsibilities:

 The Collision Center Body Shop Apprentice is expected to:

 * Protect the legal, financial and moral well-being of the Larry H. Miller Companies dealerships;

 * Assist to repair damaged vehicles using appropriate tools, technologies, and ICAR procedures in order to restore vehicle to pre-accident/damaged state, factory specifications and customer satisfaction;

 * Achieve and maintain all applicable training and certifications required to perform job duties;

 * Be a teacher to support the efforts of other employees to be successful;

 * Seek ways to improve business operations efficiencies and customer service.

 Primary Duties:

 * Assist Body Shop Technician to perform all body and fender repairs utilizing welding, body alignment and structural operations.

 * Assist Body Shop Technician to disassemble and assess any supplemental vehicle needs, labor, parts, and communicate with estimator.

 * Assist Body Shop Technician to perform quality repairs at all times and notify management of any substandard processes, parts or procedures.

 * Communicate with appropriate personnel regarding any issue which may cause a repair delay to a vehicle.

 * Proactively take part in learning and maintain current product and technical knowledge through manuals, training, experience, and Body Shop Technicians.

 * Maintain a clean and safe work environment at all times and adhere to all OSHA/EPA requirements

 * Perform all job duties requested from management.

 Operate with integrity:

 * Demand the highest ethical standards from self and others.

 * Set an example of positive attitude and professionalism, including a neat, orderly and safe work environment.

 * Assist to communicate and resolve customer complaints and adjustments

 Job Qualifications:

 * High school diploma or the equivalent recommended but not required.

 * Maintain valid driver's license and MVR within company policy requirements.

 * Ensure timely enrollment and attendance to a manufacturer's apprentice program.

 * Customer Service:

 * Be service oriented and actively looking for ways to help

 * Represent the company to all employees and customers in all communications

 * Ability to use hand and power tools as well as other machinery safely.

 * Reliable- being dependable in fulfilling job obligations

 * Adaptable- open to change and variety within the workplace

 Physical Requirements:

 * Work performed in a shop setting due to location of tools and customer vehicles.

 * While performing the duties of this job, the employee is exposed to weather conditions precedent at that time.

 * Exposure to shop environment such as noise, dust, odors and fumes, chemicals and adhesives.

 * Required to lift up to 100 lbs.

 * Regularly required to sit, stand, bend, reach, talk, hear, use hands and fingers, handle or operate objects, tools, or controls.

 * Occasionally required to stoop, kneel, crouch.

 * Required vision include close vision, distance vision, peripheral vision and the ability to adjust focus

 * Required to operate equipment and move vehicles in a safe manner at all times.

 To perform the job successfully, an individual should demonstrate the following competencies to perform the essential functions of this position:

 * Leadership- the individual demonstrates ethical and followership behaviors which promotes Larry H. Miller standards resulting in a cohesive and effective team.

 * Compliance- the individual understands and adheres to all Company standards, state and federal laws and regulations as well as product pricing guidelines of all lenders, agencies or business partners.

 * Customer Service- the individual understands his/her role in providing excellent customer service through the defined Larry H. Miller processes which promote efficiencies, fairness and cost effectiveness.

 * Ethics/Integrity- the individual represents the Larry H. Miller Group of Companies by conducting his/her self in a professional and courteous business manner that demonstrates integrity and avoids the actual or perception of a conflict of interest.

 * Oral Communication- the individual clearly identifies and professionally expresses issues in positive or negative situations.

 * Planning/Organizing- the individual prioritizes and plans work activities and uses time efficiently.

 * Quality- the individual demonstrates accuracy and thoroughness and monitors own work to ensure quality.

 * Dependability- the individual is consistently at work and on time, follows instructions, responds to management direction and solicits feedback to improve performance.

 * Safety and Security- the individual observes safety and security procedures and uses equipment and materials properly.

 Note: The need may arise to revise, supplement, or rescind portions of this job description, and dealership management reserves the right to do so at anytime. Employee shall be required to meet the qualifications and perform the duties of any revised job description.

 Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled

****Larry H. Miller Honda parts manager position**** We are looking for candidates with extensive auto parts experience including a proven track record of success in the position as well as proven leadership skills. The department is in excellent order, clean and has been well managed for many years; looking for the right person to take it to the next level of business success. As a part of the Larry Miller Group the compensation package is very competitive and the position comes with full insurance benefit options, 401k, paid time off, dependent college scholarship program, Christmas bonus and much more.  * Maintain knowledge of factory guidelines, policies and procedures and ensure department is following appropriate procedures.

 * Maintain general knowledge of warranty P&P and return procedures.

 * Handle all complaints within the Parts Department, settle disputes and resolve grievances and conflicts, or otherwise negotiate with employees, customers and vendors within Larry H. Miller Dealership's guidelines while working closely with the General Manager.

 * Maintain employee, customer and vendor confidence while protecting operations by exercising discretion when handling sensitive confidential information.

 * Maintain ability to handle job stress and effective interaction with others in the workplace.

 * Perform all other job duties as requested by management.

 * Control Expenses

 * Budget, review and approve all controllable expense factors.

 * Monitor all adjustments on repairs and maintenance estimates.

 * Approve all requisitions for materials and supplies.

 * Monitor all schedules and assist accounting personnel in collection of past due accounts.

 * Develop Employees

 * Effectively recruit, hire, train and manage qualified team members.

 * Ensure timely and effective management of dealership personnel to foster a progressive culture, which nurtures learning and ability to succeed.

 * Conform and educate employees on job expectations, all applicable and current company procedures and policies, federal, state and local regulations affecting operations.

 * Be the example of a team player through good attitude, professionalism and employee recognition to maintain positive employee morale.

 * Handle and resolve employee issues within Larry H. Miller Dealerships' guidelines.

 * Ensure employee development and performance reviews are occurring on a regular basis.

 * Establish working hours, schedules, time off and vacations.

 * Maintain accurate job descriptions and communicate expectations with employees.

 * Operate with Integrity

 * Demand the highest ethical standards from self and others.

 Maintain composure within the workplace as well as outside the workplace when interacting or representing the Larry H. Miller Dealerships'.

 * Set an example of positive attitude and professionalism, including a neat, orderly and safe work environment.

 Minimum Qualifications:

 Must be 18 years of age or older to qualify for this position.

 * Education

 * High school diploma or the equivalent.

 * Experience

 * 5+ years' experience in an automotive Parts Department.

 * 5+ years' sales experience.

 * 1- year supervisory experience.

 * Certifications/Training

 * Maintain valid driver's license and MVR record within company policy requirements.

 * Maintain valid OSHA Forklift Certification. If applicable.

 * Maintain valid DOT Hazmat Shipping Certification.

 * Skills

 * Active Learning- Understanding the implications of new information for both current and future problem-solving and decision-making.

 Compliance- Understanding of and adherence to all Company standards, state and federal laws and regulations as well as product pricing guidelines of all lenders, agencies or business partners.

 Customer Service- Providing excellent customer service through the defined Larry H. Miller processes which promote efficiencies, fairness and cost effectiveness.
