https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/919747.name: Helpdesk Tier II
https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/919747.employer: Larry H. Miller Group of Companies
https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/919747.description:
JOB SUMMARY:

 The Help Desk Tier II technician role provides a career growth opportunity. You will be working for a company that strives to be "The best place to work, and the best place to do business". This is a mid-level help desk position providing end user computer support.

 Supported products and services include setup, deployment and maintenance of various desktop/laptop hardware and software, online software, peripheral devices including printers, copiers, scanners, phones and handheld devices. The technician responds to phone calls, tickets, chat and walkups to resolve problems and implement solutions. You will work closely with your peers and be part of a fantastic team. When you encounter issues that extend beyond Tier II, you will need to escalate and work with the appropriate teams to resolution.

 DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:

 * Protect the legal, financial and moral well-being of the Group;

 * Desktop maintenance throughout the lifecycle of equipment (procure, deploy, inventory, manage, protect and dispose)

 * Manage service desk tickets and meet the SLAs defined by the business

 * Support the 24/7 nature of the business by working weekends, holidays and events, as well as taking shifts on the on-call rotation

 * Communicate with computer users on status of issues and understand the needs they have in relation to technology

 * Install computer images in compliance with company policy

 * Support point of sale systems in a retail environment

 * Exceed the expectations of the end users while resolving their technology issues

 * Troubleshoot all technology-related problems and bring issues to a successful and timely resolution

 * Train staff in proper procedures and appropriate use of systems, software and hardware to ensure conformity, stability and simplicity

 * Assist in maintaining proper expenses for IT equipment and services

 * Consolidate and simplify any systems and processes where it makes business sense and where efficiencies can be gained

 * All other duties as assigned by management as company needs may dictate

 * Exemplify the LHM Group of Companies mission, vision and values (https://www.lhm.com/mission-values/)

 * Support the building of a diverse culture that enriches the lives of our employees, customers, partners and communities.

 * Embrace a culture of inclusion where guests and team members feel welcomed, valued and heard

 * Enrich lives by creating winning experiences and timeless memories

 * Operate with an emphasis on safety for employees, teams, and guests

 * Protect the legal, financial, and moral well-being of the company

 * Be a student. Be a teacher. Be a leader.

 COMPETENCIES:

 * Cultivates innovation -- Creates new and better ways for the organization to be successful.

 * Communicates effectively -- Develops and delivers multi-mode communications that convey a clear understanding of the unique needs of different audiences.

 * Manages complexity -- Makes sense of complex, high quantity, and sometimes contradictory information to effectively solve problems.

 * Strategic mindset -- Sees ahead to future possibilities and translates them into breakthrough strategies.

 * Tech savvy -- Anticipates and adopts innovations in business-building digital and technology applications.

 * Interpersonal savvy -- Relates openly and comfortably with diverse groups of people.

 QUALIFICATIONS:

 * CompTIA A+ Certification preferred

 * 2+ years of experience, or equivalent, working in a help desk environment

 * Proficiency with MAC and IOS computers preferred

 * Certifications in relevant IT products and technologies preferred (e.g. Network +, Server+ and Security+)

 * Prior experience working with Jira and/or Freshservice is desired but must have experience with ticketing system and help desk tools

 * Highly organized to keep help desk tickets up to date and closed out in a timely manner

 * Experience in hardware, software, and network troubleshooting, or equivalent training and/or education are necessary

 * Customer service training and/or experience are beneficial

 * Ability to handle confidential information in an appropriate manner

 * Customer interactions should be handled with diplomacy and tact

 * Individual should be able to gauge the customer's technical ability and communicate with them in appropriate technical or non-technical language in a non-condescending manner

 * Ability to work independently or in a team setting is necessary

 * Ability to learn and support new and fast-changing technologies

 * Familiarity with a wide range of standard office automation products

 * Flexibility to work a variety of shifts, including overtime, with minimal notice

 PHYSICAL DEMANDS:

 * Ability to communicate and express themselves both written and verbally

 * Demonstrable ability to observe, inspect, estimate and assess

 * Ability to sit, stand, bend, walk, and climb stairs for long periods of time

 * Ability to lift 20 lbs.

 * Must have valid driver's license with reliable transportation and be able to get to the different company properties when needed

 Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled

- Detail Oriented, and Problem Solving Skills-required

https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/919253.name: Service Coordinator - Customer Service
https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/919253.description:
At Zoom we take great care in cultivating the careers of our employees. We offer training and room for growth because we recognize that career advancement is a large part of job satisfaction. For those who meet these requirements, a challenging environment with plenty of opportunity awaits.

Zoom maintains a healthy corporate culture that values the contributions of our employees. Superior customer service are our hallmarks. We go out of our way to ensure that we’re responsive to our customer’s needs and our employees are rewarded accordingly.

As a fast-growing industry leader, our customers are assured that Zoom’s service is unparalleled. Our Technicians are some of the most highly trained individuals in the business. Zoom’s name stands apart as a caring employer that provides sound opportunities to advance within the company.

At Zoom, our Service Coordinators are the life-blood of our business. Everything starts with them. Customers get their first impressions of Zoom the moment the telephone call is answered. Service Coordinators at Zoom are engaged and compassionate to our customers needs. Their goals are to answer each call swiftly, empathize with the customer, gather information about the service request, enter that information into our software system, and then quickly dispatch a technician to the site of the drain emergency.

https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/918475.name: UI/UX Designer
https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/918475.description:
CrewTracks is hiring UI/UX Designers who are passionate about using technology to make the world a better place. We are committed to help and innovate for the people who build and maintain our world! What is it like to work at CrewTracks? Our product team doesn't throw spec documents over an imaginary wall only to have engineering build something and throw it over another wall to QA. Our teams are collaborative — we sit together, brainstorm together, and build together because we believe that's the only way to make superior products. We're committed to innovation. We encourage individuals and teams build pet projects and aim for the fences with radical new ideas.

 

What We Do:

- We're building innovative applications focused helping those who build and maintain our world.

- Our team has and a strong preference for simple, elegant solutions.

 

What we look for:

- Proficient in Sketch, and Adobe Creative Suite, specifically XD.

- Strong knowledge of interaction design and methodology.

- Ability to work collaboratively with teams across multiple locations.

- Self-directed with highly developed ability to prioritize and meet deadlines.

- Solid understanding of user research and user centered design.

https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/919743.name: Sales Rep
https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/919743.description:
Hi, I am Chris, the CEO of WealthTechs, a market leading, early stage FinTech with 75 high profile, referenceable customers with over $1 trillion in assets. Our product is in the wealth management financial account data aggregation space. Here's my standard explanation of who we are and what we do.

"WealthTechs is a financial data technology company providing custodian data processing solutions to investment advisors, custodians and fintechs serving advisors. Advisors require daily customer account data from custodian banks and broker dealers to feed their mission critical IT tech stack systems like: portfolio accounting, compliance, trading, reporting, billing and CRM. WealthTechs’ custodian data aggregation and normalization platform coupled with WealthTechs’ intelligent data transformation software seamlessly integrates with most popular advisor systems such as InData, Orion, Paxus, Axys, APX, Geneva, AssetBook, Portfolio Center, WealthSite, or advisor’s other systems using our API or SFTP file delivery systems. WealthTechs’ customers’ bottom line is where we shine. Due to our innovative technology and deep cost savings, customers exponentially increase their profits over the long term by lowering the total cost of ownership of custodian data and reconciliation labor by 50% or more versus our competition. WealthTechs guarantees it!"

I’m looking for a sales rep to help me to sell to new customers. The ideal candidate has done complex B2B enterprise sales before, knows the process of cold calling, emailing, LinkedIn connections, influencing on LinkedIn, running trials/pilot tests, persistence, patience and most importantly: selling benefits and not showing up and throwing up. Again, let me be very clear, this is a B2B sale, so the ideal candidate must understand the needs of businesses; no MLM types allowed!!!

In my experience; there are 2 reasons businesses buy new tech, 1) it saves money or 2) it makes money. The great thing about this job is you get to sell a solution that does both, and the competition does not. The sales cycle is relatively long, but it’s a super sticky sale and customers typically stay for years, if not for life. Also it’s a complicated sale, so the ideal candidate must be able to handle details, learn the product, the industry and the implementation process that assures our customer success. The target market we sell to are registered investment advisors, custodian banks & broker dealers. The nice thing about this industry is it is government regulated, so all of the key contacts at the firms we sell to are registered on the federal government web site. We also sell to fintechs that sell their products to the same market because they need our data to fire up their apps. Fintechs obviously are not government regulated, so their contact info is not on a government website. We have built our own CRM that contains all of this info, but it needs to be updated constantly as people and companies change all the time. This requires that you are in periodic contact with prospects to assure you are working with the right people. We are super vigilant about updating CRM so we all know what's going on with any customer at any point in the sales cycle.

The ideal candidate, although it’s not absolutely necessary has experience selling tech to our market and knows the intricacies of investments such as stocks, bonds, options, funds and other publicly traded securities. If you know that stocks pay dividends and bonds pay interest, that's a good start! If you are an actual investor, or have a professional investment advisor managing your money, that's even better. For the right person, this is a great opportunity to get in at the ground level of a potential $1 billion company, learn a valuable skill set and build a long lucrative career. We have gotten the business to first base, I need you to help take it to second. Just so you know what you’re getting into, the first job that you will do after learning the basics of our business is setting up appointments with prospective customers This involves cold calling. Once you book the appointment, I will do all the talking and presenting on the call and you will listen in and learn. Over time, you’ll be able to do these calls and presentations on your own. I’m looking for a smart worker who is not scared of learning something new and really wants a career, not a paycheck. If you are smart, you will probably be taking sales from start to finish with minimal input from me within 6 months.

Compensation will grow with your experience and the ability to do things on your own without being micromanaged. The starting salary of $60-90K for the job is exactly that, starting salary. If you thrive at this job, bring in business, build relationships with customers and resellers, assure their success through the implementation and ongoing management of the accounts, up sell new products to your customers; your salary could grow exponentially, easily exceeding $200k per year.

Our company is a tight knit group of nice, intelligent, smart, hard-working people, we are really family more than business associates. I live and work from my home in Sandy, Utah and I would very much like to hire someone local if possible, but it is not absolutely critical if you are the right person. I do think working together in person makes it much faster and easier to get up to speed. Of course, we need to respect Covid and make sure that safety comes first.

As you can tell from this detailed job description, I am dead serious about finding the right person for this job. If everything works out, stock options, management, opening an office, whatever you want is possible.

If this sounds like you, please reach out to me and let’s talk.

https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/919185.name: Bartender at SeventyOne Restaurant
https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/919185.description:
Job Description

 SeventyOne restaurant is a busy American comfort food bar and grill located inside the beautiful Cliff Lodge hotel.

 Under the direction of the Manager provides quality service and consistent quality drinks to guests that exceed expectations. Responsible for making and serving all alcoholic beverages in the restaurant and/or lounge.

 Position Functions / Areas of Responsibility - Reports to work on time in the proper uniform. Obeys all company rules and regulations.

- Prepares for his/her assigned station, is ready to assist others if needed and completes daily duties before and after the shift in order to maintain appearance and cleanliness of station for guest service and efficiency between shifts.

- Greets and informs guests of specials and menu changes and employs suggestive selling techniques in order to enhance the guest experience and to increase company revenues.

- Addresses and anticipates guest needs. Keeps tables and /or bar neat and clean throughout service.

- Provides guests with proper utensils and condiments. Keeps all water and beverage glasses filled as requested.

- Responsible to serve alcohol according State Alcohol law and regulations.

- Responsible for all financial transactions for services. Obtains bank at the beginning of the shift and verifies monies. Rings out guest checks and collects payments. Runs end of shift reports, counts out drawer and makes deposits.

- Reconciles receipts for total sales. Research problems in Accounting.

- Maintains sanitation of area. Maintains good safety practices of employees and guests throughout the property and follows state policies and regulations for serving alcoholic beverages in a responsible manner.

- Participates in ongoing employee training. Takes part in all sales goals and incentive programs in order to improve performance of guest service standards.

- Treats guests and employees with respect and in a pleasant manner, takes fast and appropriate action to solve problems and handles guest and internal concerns in a professional manner in order to meet guest expectations and company service standards.

- Ensures standards of appearance and sanitation are maintained on a daily basis. Maintains good safety practices of employees and guests throughout the property.

- Follows state policies and regulations for serving alcoholic beverages in a responsible manner.

 Interactions - Must have the ability to interact at any time with guests and other employees in a pleasant manner and maintain good working relationships with others and all departments at Snowbird.

 Education & Experience Requirements - High School Diploma or equivalent required.

- 1-2 years of job-specific work experience with demonstrated competence.

 Specific Requirements - Must be at least 21 years of age.

- Food Handler Permit, Tips Cert, Sheriff Work Card

 Skills & Knowledge - Must demonstrate competency in reading, writing, and arithmetic.

- Must demonstrate the ability to learn menus, recipes and wine lists.

- Must demonstrate proficiency in handling and keeping record of large sums of money in a self-banking environment.

- Ability to multi-task, i.e., serve many guests at once and track tabs while maintaining good customer service and interactions between the dining room and kitchen.

- Ability to delegate.

- Must demonstrate good interpersonal skills, including excellent customer service, listening, and oral communication skills. Must demonstrate organizational skills and ability to transport fragile items in busy areas.

 Administrative - Ability to handle, process, maintain and protect guest personal information, including credit card information, in compliance with all company or department policies and procedures according to PCI rules and requirements. This includes privacy and confidentiality, reporting, storage and disposal of sensitive information. Will not share or disclose any guest personal or financial information to anyone unless authorized by the guest, manager or company or unless disclosure is permitted within departmental policies and procedures.

- Knowledge and understanding of PCI DSS, including the safe and secure handling and maintenance of personal, financial and credit card information of guest/customers.

- Requires some exercise of judgment within policy guidelines and without supervisory approval.

- Requires some problem solving and initiation of activities within job description and responsibility limitations.

- Requires a strong understanding of other Snowbird operations.

 Work Schedule - Shifts vary, may be early morning or late evening, weekends, holidays, depending on business levels. Generally afternoon shift will be 12pm-8pm or PM shifts 4pm -12am any day of the week.

 Working Conditions - Must be prepared to stay overnight if necessary on occasional times of road closures.

- May experience unusual stress from high business volumes, deadlines, continual work with the public, winter conditions, snow night requirements and commuting to/from Snowbird.

- Must be able to lift 25+ lbs.

- Must be able to carry trays and other items needed for service.

- Must be able to stand for long periods of time.

- Must demonstrate the ability to bend, kneel, handle, reach, grasp and perform repetitive motions

 All job opportunities at Snowbird Ski & Summer Resort require the ability to comply with our Professional Appearance, Drug & Alcohol, and Employee Conduct Policies.

 This job description is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all duties, responsibilities, or qualifications associated with the job.

https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/919178.description:
Ability and Choice Services, Inc. (ACS) is calling all caring people in the Draper, UT area who would be interested in working with individuals with developmental disabilities as a full-time or part-time Direct Support Professional (DSP) to apply to join our amazing caregiving team!

Please see important information regarding benefit plans, background checks and eligibility to work here

WHY YOU SHOULD

This is a great opportunity to get some entry-level experience in the essential human services field with a well-respected organization that has been serving Utah for over 30 years. We have both full-time and part-time positions available and pay our Direct Support Professionals (DSPs) a competitive entry-level wage of $11.50-$12.50/hour. We also offer great full-time benefits that include low cost medical plans. We even make it easy to apply with our initial quick and easy mobile-optimized application. If we have your attention, please continue reading about this entry-level position in human services!

ARE YOU A GOOD FIT FOR THIS ENTRY-LEVEL DIRECT SUPPORT PROFESSIONAL (DSP) POSITION?

For this entry-level human services job, we are looking for someone who is calm and patient and can show empathy while maintaining professional boundaries. Ask yourself: Are you punctual and reliable? Can you keep track of multiple tasks and prioritize effectively? Do you have strong communication and interpersonal skills? Are you conscientious about following policies and procedures and discreet with confidential information? If so, please consider applying for a full-time or part-time Direct Support Professional (DSP) position today!

ABOUT ABILITY AND CHOICE SERVICES, INC. (ACS)

Family-owned since 1987, we operate a social and community access hub in Salt Lake and Tooele Counties along with integrated employment supports and in-home care for adults with developmental disabilities. Our day program serves as a community gathering hub for participants to socialize, learn life skills, and access the greater community with their peers. Our participants (along with staff) enjoy going to community assets such as parks, the zoo, the aquarium, the movies, volunteering, and bowling--as well as taking semi-annual field trips to destinations such as Wendover and Boondocks.

Our wonderful staff is at the heart of the great human services we provide to adults with developmental disabilities. That's why we offer great benefits and an awesome work environment and culture.

While developing strong relationships with customers as a service writer, you must understand their problems and be committed to solving them. Service writers translate their customers' needs into work orders for technicians, prepare quotes for customers and bill customers when work is complete. Service technicians may become service writers, who themselves may aspire to become an administrative lead at the company.

It helps to have at least three years of work experience in the company's industry, such as auto repair or prior service work. Excellent customer services skills are also necessary for this job, and you must be able to handle customer complaints and disputes. Description:

PAY: $15/hour+ depending on experience

We are keeping our firefighters safe! $500 Bonus! Growth Opportunities! ECMS specializes in the inspection, cleaning, and repair of personal protective ensembles (PPE) and ensemble elements used for structural, wildland, industrial, and aviation firefighting applications. ECMS also serves as a highly skilled resource for aftermarket alterations, modifications and accessories for PPE and ensemble elements. Providing support services for personal protective ensembles is our only business, and we take great pride in doing it well.

About the Position

We are looking for a versatile, motivated Sewer/Seamstress. The main responsibility of this role is sewing, with growth opportunities to support evaluation of PPE elements & data entry.

What You'll Be Doing

- Perform repairs and alterations, and add accessory items to personal protective ensemble elements.

- Contribute to the production of finished goods such as letter patches, hose straps, shrouds, gear bags and other items.

- Follow established patterns and specifications, as well as create new patterns and specifications as necessary.

- Alter sizing on uniforms.

- Learn NFPA 1851 and other industry standards and how they relate to our processes and procedures.

- Data entry including, but not limited to element information, order entry, work performed, customer information, shipping details, etc.

- Sort, organize, inspect and launder personal protective ensemble elements.

- Assist with material inventory counts, shipping, and receiving.

- Use handheld hardware and tools as necessary.

- Operate company vehicles for pickup and delivery functions.

. Requirements:

Must Have Skills

- Strong sewing ability.

- Professional experience with heavy fabric and hardware.

Must Have Soft Skills

- Strong work ethic with proven attention to detail.

- Willingness to learn and be flexible.

- Demonstrated good judgement and a high degree of integrity.

- Self-starter with willingness to do whatever is necessary to support the team.

Nice to Have

- Experience with various industrial sewing machines.

- Experience with pattern creation.

- Professional data entry experience.

- Ability to lift and handle 50 pounds.

- Shipping and receiving.

- Inspection and laundering of clothing.

- Pattern reading.

- Industrial stitching skills using, walking-foot, industrial style, sewing equipment is instrumental to the success of this role.

Work Perks

We currently offer a generous benefit package to all of our regular full-time employees, which includes:

- Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance

- Long Term Disability and Life Insurance

- Flexible Spending Account (FSA) – health and dependent care

https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/919141.name: Licensed Clinical Social Worker (LCSW) - Sugarhouse Health Center Integrated Behavioral Health
https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/919141.description:
Overview

 As a patient-focused organization, University of Utah Health exists to enhance the health and well-being of people through patient care, research and education. Success in this mission requires a culture of collaboration, excellence, leadership, and respect. University of Utah Health seeks staff that are committed to the values of compassion, collaboration, innovation, responsibility, diversity, integrity, quality and trust that are integral to our mission. EO/AA

 The Licensed Clinical Social Worker (LCSW) in this position provides professional counseling services of a preventative and developmental nature through direct consultation with patients. Therapy activities include individual, group and couples counseling. The incumbent develops program criteria for area of specialization such as couples or addictive behavior counseling. This position may be responsible for supervising the work of Social Workers, Interns or other caseworkers.

 Behavioral Health Integration at University of Utah Health

 Corporate Overview: The University of Utah is a Level 1 Trauma Center and is nationally ranked and recognized for our academic research, quality standards and overall patient experience. Our four hospitals and seventeen clinics provide excellence in our comprehensive services, medical advancement, and overall patient outcomes.

 Responsibilities

 - Develops and implements individualized treatment approach to meet the needs of each patient and their families.

 - Works in close collaboration with all members of the treatment team including medical doctors, to further their understanding of significant social and emotional factors contributing to the patient's well being.

 - Identifies appropriate outside resources, such as community agencies, to assist patients with resuming life in their own community and how to live with the patient's limitations.

 - Assists in the development of departmental policies and procedures.

 - Oversees and supervises Social Worker Interns.

 - May perform Case Management duties.

 Knowledge / Skills / Abilities

 - Ability to communicate verbally as well as in writing.

 - Ability to work independently and provide individual, group and couples counseling.

 - Ability to oversee the activities of Social Workers, Interns and other caseworkers in their area.

 - Ability to assess data regarding the patient's status and provide care as described in the department's policies and procedures manual.

 - Ability to assist patients and their families with post-treatment adjustments including but not limited to working closely with local, state and federal agencies to ensure the patient receives the appropriate assistance.

 Qualifications

 Qualifications Required

 - Two years directly related experience.

 - Experience with conflict resolution when counseling individuals, couples and groups.

 Licenses Required

 - Current Licensed Clinical Social Worker (LCSW) certificate for clinical practice in the State of Utah.

 - Current RQI Healthcare Provider eCredential through the University of Utah Health RQI system. The eCredential is to be obtained within 30 days of hire.

 * Additional license requirements as determined by the hiring department.

 Qualifications (Preferred)

 Preferred

 - Experience working with community resources, instructing and supervising Social Workers, Interns and other caseworkers.

 Working Conditions and Physical Demands

 Employee must be able to meet the following requirements with or without an accommodation.

 - This position involves intermediate work that may exert up to 50 pounds and may consistently require lifting, carrying, pushing, pulling or otherwise moving objects while providing patient care to those requiring psychiatric care.

 We are University of Utah Health. Employment.utah.edu

 Physical Requirements

 Non Indicated

 EEO Statement

 The University of Utah Health Care is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity employer. Upon request, reasonable accommodations in the application process will be provided to individuals with disabilities. The University of Utah Health Care is committed to diversity in its workforce. Women and minorities are encouraged to apply.

https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/919562.name: Bookkeeper Office Manager
https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/919562.description:
RedSky Technologies, a leading-edge tech company located in Spanish Fork Utah has created a wide variety of web and mobile based software as well as a number of other sub companies such as powder coating, body armor and gun parts manufacturing and more.

Our company is currently seeking ​a Bookkeeper Office Manager to join our team!

To give you an idea of some of the exciting technologies and products that RedSky has created, we actively own and work on the following companies:

- Private Label VR / VR Junkies - A Virtual Reality company that provides turnkey VR Arcades to Family Fun Centers / Trampoline parks / Bowling Alleys. We have created our own software sweet to manage CRMs, Content License Management, 3D Game selectors and more

- Vendoti - A live streaming e-commerce platform used in the direct selling marketplace. We have created mobile / desktop / webapps for facilitating transactions as well as a real time video streaming infrastructure.

- Great Basin Powder Coating - A powder coating shop located in Delta UT that is using technology to facilitate rapid quoting systems and task management in a more efficient manager than has ever been done in the industry

- Outdoor Ops / Predator Armor - A body plate armor company providing plate carrier protection for civilians

- RedSky Technologies Development Shop - A number of development contracts are coordinated directly through RedSky.

You will be responsible for preparing and examining financial records for all our companies.

Responsibilities:

- Obtain primary financial data for accounting records

- Compute and record numerical data

- Check the accuracy of business transactions

- Perform data entry and administrative duties

- Prepare cashflow spreadsheets

- Perform general office manager duties, HR filings, payroll submission, etc.

Qualifications:

- Previous experience in accounting, finance, or other related fields

- Intimately familiar with Quickbooks Online or other Accounting Software

- Fundamental knowledge of GAAP

- Ability to prioritize and multitask

- Strong organizational skills

- Deadline and detail-oriented

https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/919718.description:
Sign-on Bonus available!!!

Animal Care Center seeks motivated, self-starting Veterinary Technicians to join our AMAZING team!

At Animal Care Center, you will be expected to practice the best medicine, be proactive, and work efficiently in a fast-paced environment while providing compassionate, Fear Free care.

Ideal Candidate:

- Utilizes superior customer care and communication skills

- Advocates for patients and treats them as our own

- Uses appropriate handling and restraint techniques

- Has recent veterinary technician experience

- Knowledge of basic veterinary practices, procedures and terminology--with willingness to pursue further education

- Must have recent experience in veterinary practice

Why work at Animal Care Center?

At Animal Care Center our goal is to exceed our client's expectations in each and every service we perform. It is a place where pets are treated like family members with state of the art care in a clean, caring, and friendly environment.

We invest in our employees with many opportunities for growth and development! We offer outstanding benefits including medical, dental, and vision insurance, 401(k), paid parental leave, PTO, generous pet care discounts, and much more! Visit our website for more information about our practice: https://www.utahanimalcarecenter.com/.

https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/919704.name: Underground Excavator
https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/919704.description:
Who We Are

Scott Hale Plumbing, Heating & Air is a rapidly growing business in Salt Lake City that is looking for an experienced Drain Technician to add to our team. We keep on growing because we only hire the best, and our customers love us for it. People often come to us looking for a job. They stay with us because they find a fulfilling career, room to grow, and opportunities to excel. We have been in the service industry for over 30 years! You have probably seen our trucks and our ads.

What We Do

We are a team of home service experts who go the extra mile to ensure peak performance for our customer’s home plumbing, drains, heating and air conditioning systems.

The Big Task

You will excavate and repair residential drain systems.

Key Sub Tasks

·        Maintain communication with dispatch, your manager, parts and installation teams.

·        Keep your company truck clean, inside and out.

·        Keep your truck inventory up to date.

·        Properly complete paperwork.

·        Join the on-call rotation.

·        Maintain a clean and professional appearance.

·        Have and maintain a clean driving record.

·        Participate in training allowing you to grow and develop as a professional.

·        Have or be willing to get the proper certifications. We can help you with this.

Desired Skills and Experience

·        4 years relevant excavation experience

·        Must be able to perform basic drain cleaning skills.

·        Must be able to remove and reset a toilet.

·        Must be able to perform camera inspections on drain lines.

 What We Offer

·        Medical Insurance – we pay a portion of you and your family’s insurance premiums

·        401k Plan with a 5% company match

·        Sign On Bonus

·        Profit Sharing

·        Paid holidays and vacation

·        On-site gym

·        Company supplied, take it home at night, fully stocked company vehicle.

·        Weekly and Monthly incentives.

·        A FAMILY. This is last on the list because it’s the most important. We care about our team, and expect you to bring that same caring when you join.

If you want to be part of something bigger than just a job – make this a career move and find exactly what you’re looking for. You will work in a place where you will be appreciated by your team and customers, and where your work has a direct effect on the success of the company. If this sounds like you, spend a little time learning about Scott Hale Plumbing, Heating & Air by visiting www.scotthale.com

We’re a HALE of a company!

The University Faculty Information & Support (UFIS) department is seeking an experienced Sr Application Systems Analyst with solid leadership and technical analytical experience to help lead and contribute to a diverse and energetic team. You’ll actively work to facilitate the flow of business and technical requirements to the product, development and test teams, while maintaining an end-to-end view of the solution and driving the right outcomes in a planned, incremental and iterative fashion.

This position is considered Category IIA: Not required on campus and has the ability to telework remotely for the duration of the University of Utah’s response to COVID-19. An employee hired into this role will be responsible for providing space, telephone, printing, networking and/or internet capabilities at the telecommute location and agree to the terms of the University of Utah campus and Health Academics COVID-19 Telecommuting Agreement.

About University Faculty Information & Support

University Faculty Information & Support provides administrative applications and support to leadership across all colleges at the University of Utah including University of Utah Health Academics (non-clinical). Our information systems and integration with other institutional data sources allow us to provide comprehensive management of faculty data and faculty-centric processes in support of the various missions of the university.

What You Bring

- Strong technology aptitude who can lead a team while being a solid individual contributor.

- Juggling skills – ability to handle multiple projects, interact with multiple teams and an innate ability to keep it all together and running smoothly.

- Strong business process and systems analysis background, with at least 5 years spent working with agile methodologies.

- In-depth understanding of application development, technologies, and software development lifecycles (both legacy and current).

- Experience in a large-scale IT organization with complex systems environment & infrastructure.

- Excellent communication skills, both written and spoken evidenced by the ability to communicate across all levels of an organization.

- Experienced in enterprise application integration, middleware technologies, data migrations and conversions, database technologies and backend interfaces.

University of Utah Job ID# PRN25864B - 01828 - Univ Faculty Info & Support

COMPENSATION: $88,000 - $101,000/year

WORK SCHEDULE: Full Time

https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/919064.name: Administrative Assistant
https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/919064.description:
The National Commission for the Certification of Crane Operators (NCCCO) is an essential business providing necessary services to the load-handling industry and has an opportunity to join a growing and dynamic team!

Since 1995, NCCCO has developed effective performance testing standards for those working in and around load handling equipment, including cranes. NCCCO is the national leader in providing crane operator certification and has been deemed as an essential service. We are committed to quality, integrity, and fairness in testing and have issued certifications in all 50 states. NCCCO has offices in Murray, Utah, Fairfax, Virginia and Palm Harbor, Florida.

NCCCO has an immediate opening for an Administrative Assistant position in our Murray, Utah office. This position supports the work of management and other staff, by performing functions such as answering phones, preparing workshop materials, updating records, and processing score sheet requests. The position may also conduct virtual workshop events, prepare statistical reports, and handle information requests; including assisting staff with miscellaneous duties such as updating workshop material content, quarterly reports, and other projects as requested. In addition, the position fields inquiries and questions, and emails and responds or directs callers to appropriate staff members.

This position will be required to work in office. NCCCO is committed to providing safe, clean, and appropriately low-density work environments. NCCCO complies with all CDC requirements and NCCCO's offices follow best practices with respect to COVID-19 guidelines and protocols.

Reporting Relationship:

The position will report directly to NCCCO's Manager, Practical Examiner Accreditation.

Primary Responsibilities:

The Administrative Assistant position will provide administrative support to the Quality Management department, while performing the following primary duties:

? General Office Duties

• Practical Examiner service support

• Generate/email examiner status letters

• Maintain examiner website access and assist examiners with website login issues

• Process website profile updates

• Maintain/update workshop materials

• Maintain inventory of workshop/team office supplies

• Implement approved changes to workshop materials using PPT, Word, Excel, etc.

• Create new forms while maintaining compliance with style sheet and usage guidelines

https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/559549.description:
BE THE CONNECTION.

In your role as a Clinical Marketing Liaison, you’ll have the opportunity to be the connection between your strong professional abilities and exceptional patient care that sets the standard. Apply your outstanding skills and knowledge in a different, more meaningful way. Make the most of your unique combination of talent, passion and ambition with national post-acute care leader Encompass Health.

 

What Makes Encompass Health Careers Different—and Better:

 

Working at Encompass Health means being part of something special: A team that is passionate about making an impact on patients’ lives each day. Unlike the typical hospital setting, Encompass Health offers you the unique opportunity to walk alongside patients on their road to recovery from stroke, spinal cord injuries, neurological disorders, joint replacements, multiple trauma and cardiac/pulmonary conditions. As you help patients achieve goals and regain independence, you can form significant relationships with them and celebrate the successes they experience along the way.

 

Our culture of compassion and collaboration is founded on more than just the care we provide our patients; it is expressed in the values we live. We encourage and empower each employee to keep learning and growing by providing the resources to deliver a better way to care. At Encompass Health, you’ll find something decidedly different and more satisfying: A career that is challenging, inspiring and rewarding. Maximize your talent and join a team that is committed to setting the standard for better healthcare with this engaging opportunity:

 

CLINICAL MARKETING LIAISON

Here is your opportunity to channel the full extent of your knowledge, skills, ambition, and experience on a daily basis. Inspire our patients to progress each day as you:

 

• Develop census as defined by targeted goals of the business plan.

• Build referral relationships within an assigned geographic territory, emphasizing face-to-face contact.

• Assist with coordination of the referral-to-admission process.

• Represent our company in community-related activities.

• Use territory market analysis data to identify potential new business opportunities.

• Recognize barriers to admission, respond appropriately and follow up on admissions variables.

• Provide in-services and professional presentations for referral sources, community groups and others regarding our services, programs, and outcomes.

CORE VALUES

 Drive to Innovate * Each Customer Counts * Lead from Any Seat * Trust Your Team

 Americom is a premier technology company in the Intermountain West, with a successful history of providing innovative business services, utility services and cabling services. Now a $35 million company with more than 120 employees, and headquartered in Salt Lake City, Utah, Americom serves telecom markets across the nation, with special interest in Utah, Wyoming, Idaho, and Nevada. We currently have a career opportunity for a Marketing and Event Coordinator.

 

CULTURE STATEMENTS WHICH DEFINE AMERICOM

- We engage in thought provoking conversation we do not argue.

- We lead we do not dictate.

- We coach therefore we do not need to manage.

- We are one of the team and not the team.

- We are respectful that each of us have talent and experiences that add value to the team.

- One team with one plan to reach one goal and get one result.

- We ask questions and discover fact before making a statemen

-  All our decisions are directed to improvement of the company’s profitability not individual reward.

- We listen before we speak.

- We are investigative in our challenges and innovative in our solutions.

- We do not follow the competition; we concentrate on solving real customer’s challenges.

- We encourage an environment where we challenge each other in our ideas and process and not just agree to agree.

- We are respectful that each of us have talent and experiences that add value to the team.

- We create value for the company through innovation.

- We are candor in our conversations with each other, our vendors, our customer, and ourselves.

- We are transparent. Open book, address problem directly, keeping people informed.

- Our decision encompasses the team and not just the individual.

- We are conservative in cost to conduct business yet enterprising in our ideas to support business.

POSITION SUMMARY:

 The ideal candidate is a self-starter with an entrepreneurial mind, who likes to take initiative, can work independently as well as in a team environment, is results-oriented and can drive projects from start to finish.

Candidates must embrace generating original and imaginative ideas or solutions and can see beyond today and create possibilities for tomorrow. https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/919658.name: Identity & Access Management Software Design Engineer (PRN25769B)
https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/919658.description:
The IAM Software Design Engineer is a primary force in designing and implementing solutions to transform the way the University of Utah and University of Utah Health achieve our missions. This role will require a thinker, a creator, a dreamer. In this role, you’ll work closely with other IAM Software Design Engineers, and you’ll take on projects that are as challenging as you can handle. This role is a leader in the effort to improve our security and privacy efforts and digitally transform both. As part of the Information Security Office, security is always on your mind, and you’re constantly looking for ways to improve the way we work. You find problems and fix them, within the standards of a large and mature organization. You’ll work with stakeholders to identify business needs and then with other IT and security colleagues to design the best possible solutions for their requests. You find ways to improve on their ideas, and you’re not happy with a satisfied customer – you want a delighted customer. You find ways to do that in safe and secure ways. This position will require some after-hours/weekend work to accommodate the change schedules permitted by the business but allows the right person the location and scheduling flexibility and the support to build a work-life integration that fits. The ideal candidate is passionate about this work, a self-starter, capable of working closely with others, including in geographically dispersed environments. You’ll work with a team of very smart, very capable colleagues, a wide variety of world class tools, and you’ll do it for a leading health care and higher education entity. We’ll push you to show your skills and to improve them, and we’ll invest in you and help you succeed.

About UIT: University Information Technology (UIT), the central IT service provider for campus, reports to the Chief Information Officer and is responsible for many of the University of Utah’s most critical common IT resources including the campus network; the Campus Information Services (CIS) portal; UMail, telephone, and online collaboration services; high performance and research computing; information security; teaching and learning technologies; software licensing; and a host of other systems and services. For more information about UIT visit http://www.it.utah.edu.

About the University: Located in Salt Lake City, in the foothills of the Wasatch Mountains, the University of Utah is the flagship institution of the State of Utah’s system of higher education and a member of the PAC-12 Conference. Salt Lake City combines the amenities of a major metropolitan area of more than one million people with the friendliness and ease of living of a small, Western city. Seven major ski resorts are within an hour’s drive from campus, and opportunities to pursue activities from biking to hiking to fishing abound. Salt Lake is also home to the Utah Symphony and Opera, the Utah Ballet, several professional sports teams, and a wide range of other cultural and recreational activities. http://www.employment.utah.edu/staff/work.php

This is a Category IIA position: Not required on campus and able to telework during the duration of the University’s COVID-19 response. Employees and/or functions where employees are able to work remotely in order to maintain campus systems, campus operations, clinical operations, and patient care.

University of Utah Job ID# PRN25769B - 00954 - UIT Systems & Security

COMPENSATION: $47,600/year to $60,000/year, DOE

WORK SCHEDULE: Full Time

https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/919656.name: Foreman (Underground Utilities)
https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/919656.description:
***Potential sign-on bonus of up to 5K***

B.H. Inc. of SLC, UT. is looking to hire a full-time Utility Foreman to lead a crew in underground utility and civil construction settings while adhering to all current safety standards. Are you a skilled utility foreman looking to take your career to the next level with a company that has an outstanding company culture and team atmosphere? If so, keep reading!

As an Underground Utility Foreman, you will earn $27 to $35 per hour that is negotiated based on experience, paid weekly. The schedule for this position varies but is typically five to six 8 to 10-hour days per week. You will also be eligible for benefits including health, vision, dental, life insurance, a 401k plan with match, and paid time off (PTO). If this sounds like the opportunity you've been looking for, please fill out our initial 3-minute, mobile-friendly application.

ABOUT B.H. INC.

Brad Haslem started BHI with just six other people in 1998. What started as an electrical company that operated out of a one-bay shop is now a powerhouse of a general contractor, focusing not only on instrumentation and electrical, but adding civil & excavation, facilities & pipeline, construction management, and wireless & communications. With projects and offices located across the United States, BHI is a name that is recognized and respected in the industries we serve.

We are a group of highly motivated, aggressive, goal-oriented individuals who love working as a team and growing our organization. We look at each other as family, not merely co-workers who punch the same clock. We firmly believe that our core responsibility is to develop people and provide for families. Here at BHI, we have a positive work environment and offer great pay and generous benefits.

Financial Literacy Coordinator/Basic Needs Coordinator

 

Requisition Number: S00770P: Associate VP Student Affairs Office

 

Position Category: Staff

 

Campus Location: Weber State University - Ogden, UT

Months Per Year: 12

 

Alternate Work Schedule: May work remotely one day a week if schedule allows.

 

Pay Grade: E32

 

FLSA: Exempt

 

Job Summary/Basic Function:

 

The Financial Literacy Coordinator is responsible for all aspects of the University's Money Management Center including individual financial coaching sessions, campus presentations, FAFSA support, FAFSA completion follow up, EASE fund management, works collaboratively with CCEL and the campus food pantry, and community outreach. The position is a full-time, 12-month position reporting to the Executive Director for Student Affairs Auxiliaries. The Coordinator serves as the MMC's primary representative and oversees the administration and operation of the day-to-day programs and services, staff, budget, and all other aspects of the Center.

Additionally, the Basic Needs Coordinator oversees the collaboration of efforts for all student basic needs across campus. The Coordinator will work with CCEL, food pantry, library basic needs services, and Access & Diversity department. The Coordinator will also liaison with community resources that can help students with basic needs.

 

Required Qualifications:

 

• Bachelor’s degree in finance, public relations, business, marketing, psychology, social/behavioral science, or other related field.

• One year full-time related work experience in an educational environment, financial planning, public relations, project management, student affairs, or related environment.

• Or, a Master’s degree in business, education, higher education/student affairs, or related field.

 

Preferred Qualifications:

 

• Master’s degree in business, education, higher education/student affairs, or related field.

• A combination of education, experience, and training that would produce the required knowledge and abilities could be considered.

• Experience working with FAFSA Completion initiatives.

• Written and interpersonal communication skills.

• Demonstrated ability to work effectively with diverse stakeholders including students, faculty, and staff.

• Bilingual

 

Background Check? Yes

WHAT WE DO

We are involved in one of the most important jobs there is – giving a voice to those who have been injured by others. When people have been injured and are floundering under the weight of medical expenses incurred by no fault of their own, and are facing how their lives have been changed because of their injuries, they have to tell their story to a bureaucracy whose main goal is to make them go away.

In a nutshell, we ensure that negligently injured people are truly seen and fairly treated. It is incredibly exciting and fulfilling work.

https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/879923.name: Interior Designer
https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/879923.description:
Liv Design Collective is an award-winning, interior design firm based in the Salt Lake City area. Focusing in the luxury residential as well as commercial interior design, we have a passion for serving clients. With established experience, we are constantly growing. Currently, we are looking for the right team members to set us up for even more success and growth. Our team is small yet skilled and smart. As national industry leader in design, we focus on total solutions for clients, architects and builders. We are looking for a Senior Level Interior Designer to join our team.

ENOUGH ABOUT US...HERE'S THE PROFILE OF OUR IDEAL CANDIDATE:       .

- You have a passion for award-winning design and a confidence in your design skills. 

- You understand the power of good design -- especially in construction -- and that it's not about only pillows or fluff. Your goal is to create real solutions that are both stunning and functional.  

- You have experience in high-end residential construction design as well as furnishings and finishing touches. 

- You understand importance of budget and know that good design doesn't have to mean over-budget. 

- You don’t tolerate low-quality, waste or inefficiencies.   

- You pride yourself on being the very best you can be and drive yourself harder than anyone else ever would or could. 

- You manage your time better than any other and always exceed job requirements. 

- You are willing to travel to help clients with our specialized design solutions. 

- You have 3+ years experience (for Junior Designers) as an interior designer and/or project manager and a degree in Interior Design (Bachelors preferred). 

ROLE AND BEHAVIORAL DESCRIPTIONS

- Communicate easily, clearly and confidently design solutions and processes to clients and contractors. 

- Take pride in seeing that the organization is set up for world-class experiences for our clients and contractors. 

- Study regional and national design and industry trends in both the construction and interior design industries. 

- Communicate regularly and on a timely basis information to Operations team to ensure projects are on schedule.  

- Create total solutions that help builders drive profits and clients to have streamlined projects. 

- Brand yourself individually as a profitable partner in high-end projects. 

TASKS AND RESPONSIBILITIES

- Assist Lead Designers and manage new construction, remodel and interior design projects from beginning (plan phase) to end (installation).  

- Design and draw cabinetry, space plans, finish work, ceiling details, and other necessary drawings to communicate design intent to contractors. Documentation + CAD skills are a must!  Illustrator proficiency preferred.

- Communicate ideas easily through concepts, specifications, and drawings.  

- Create aesthetically pleasing design and furniture boards and layouts. 

- Demonstrate ability to achieve aggressive timelines.

- Propose furnishings, products, and décor items for purchase. 

- Assist Purchasing in creating and following through on orders. Assist in order tracking and delivery coordination.

- Ability to assist in designing company branding & marketing initiatives a plus.

- Travel to Utah County and SLC county for installations, travel to Stansbury Park to work alongside Design Director

Pay: Base Salary based on experience

ABOUT B.H. INC.

Brad Haslem started BHI with just six other people in 1998. What started as an electrical company that operated out of a one-bay shop is now a powerhouse of a general contractor, focusing not only on instrumentation and electrical, but adding civil & excavation, facilities & pipeline, construction management, and wireless & communications. With projects and offices located across the United States, BHI is a name that is recognized and respected in the industries we serve.

We are a group of highly motivated, aggressive, goal-oriented individuals who love working as a team and growing our organization. We look at each other as family, not merely co-workers who punch the same clock. We firmly believe that our core responsibility is to develop people and provide for families. Here at BHI, we have a positive work environment and offer great pay and generous benefits.

Doing so ensures that significantly past due accounts are collected in a way that maintains critical relationships. This role directly impacts company cash flow health and ensures that the largest and most critical piece of our revenue cycle is maintained. 

This role will report directly to the Manager of Client Finance.

https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/886285.name: Construction Superintendent
https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/886285.description:
COMPANY: Arive Homes

INDUSTRY: Residential Home Building

JOB TITLE: Construction Superintendent.

DEPARTMENT: Construction

POSITION TYPE: FULL- TIME

Plus: Home Completion Bonuses

Superintendent

ROLE AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Arive Homes, Utah County's award winning residential home builder seeks an experienced residential construction superintendent to join our construction team. Superintendents are directly responsible for all facets and aspects of the home construction build process. Our Superintendents are accountable and responsible for; ensuring all homes are closed on time, trade partner & supplier supervision, managing trade partner performance, trade partner scheduling (via Buildertrend), Invoice approval, executing change orders, buyer walk-through, sales interface, and home buyer satisfaction.

Candidates should have 2+ years of experience as a residential construction superintendent, preferably building semi-custom/custom homes. A commitment to outstanding customer service is expected. Must follow through on all commitments from the beginning of home build process through any warranty items.

Candidates should have 2+ years of experience as a residential superintendent, preferably building semi-custom/custom homes. A commitment to outstanding customer service is expected. Must follow through on all commitments from the beginning of home build process through any warranty items. Competitive pay +Home Completion Bonuses.

Responsibilities Continued...

• Daily supervision and execution of the construction schedules to deliver homes on schedule through adherence to even-flow production process.

• Conducting walk-through with Customers prior to closing

• Delivering all homes with Zero Defects at time of closing

• Coordinating and managing Trades Partners to deliver high quality homes while staying to budget.

• Conducting daily inspections of every home to ensure the work is completed to Arive Home’s specifications and the job site is ready for the next Trade Partner.

• Maintain accurate up to date records, daily journals, schedules.

• Coordinating with Closing Coordinator to ensure home owner issues are quickly resolved and ready to close.

• Maintaining a clean job site for Trade Partners, Home buyers, and municipalities.

• Taking responsibility for the job site when other Superintendents are absent.

• Home completion: deliver 100% complete homes at closing.

QUALIFICATIONS AND EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS

Qualifications:

• 2+ years as superintendent building residential semi-custom/custom homes.

• Excellent organizational skills required.

• Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal skills.

• Strong work ethic towards accomplishing goals and ability to work in a team environment.

• Working knowledge of computers (Microsoft Windows, Office and general internet, Ipads).

• High School degree or equivalent.

• Valid Utah driver’s license and reliable vehicle required.

• Exceptionally organized individual with high level of attention to detail.

• Must exercise time management skills hourly, daily, weekly, monthly.

• Ability to shift priorities and handle last minute deadlines.

• Flexible, open minded willing to learn.

• Safety conscience.

• Must work in a constant sense of urgency!

• Must be upbeat and service oriented.

• Able to effectively project manage multiple projects simultaneously.

• Accountable and responsible for all things entrusted.

PREFERRED SKILLS:

• Independent and Interdependent Behavior

• Decision Making and Analytical Problem Solving

• Policy and Procedures

• Commitment to Task

• Multitasking

• Accurate and effective written and verbal communication skills.

• Ability to assess and efficiently solve problems in both office and job site settings

• Some carpentry and construction management experience preferred

• General computer skills (i.e. MS Office applications etc.), and office equipment.

• Self-starter attitude with proven ability to work as part of fast-paced construction team.

Job Type: Full-time

https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/918977.name: HVAC Technician
https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/918977.employer: Scott Hale Plumbing Heating and Air
https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/918977.description:
Who We Are

Scott Hale Plumbing, Heating & Air is a rapidly growing business in Salt Lake City that is looking for an experienced HVAC Technician to add to our team. We keep on growing because we only hire the best, and our customers love us for it. People often come to us looking for a job. They stay with us because they find a fulfilling career, room to grow, and opportunities to excel. We have been in the service industry for over 30 years! You have probably seen our trucks and our ads.

What We Do

We are a team of home service experts who go the extra mile to ensure peak performance for our customer’s home plumbing, drains, heating and air conditioning systems.

The Big Task

You will diagnose and repair residential heating and cooling systems and provide our customers with the knowledge they need to make an informed and confident buying decision.

Key Sub Tasks

·        Maintain communication with dispatch, your manager, parts and installation teams.

·        Keep your company truck clean, inside and out.

·        Keep your truck inventory up to date.

·        Properly complete paperwork.

·        Join the on-call rotation.

·        Maintain a clean and professional appearance.

We’re looking for positive, reliable people who want to experience the hidden world of the brand new Salt Lake City International airport! Our ideal employee who is excited to be a part of a team that serves the traveling public by going to work hoping to accomplish two things: share great coffee and help make the world a little better.

As a part of the company, you will have the chance to be a part of this exciting opportunity. The Barista creates the an experience for our customers by providing quality beverages and products, quick service and providing a fun and memorable experience for our guests.

- Keep the store clean, stocked, organized and decorate customer display areas

- Acts with integrity, honesty and knowledge to enhance the culture, values and mission of while following operational policies and procedures, including those for safety and security

Requirements: What skills you will need

- You have strong social skills and love to meet new people

- You have the ability to stay calm and enjoy working in a fast and exciting environment

- You love to learn new things and are able to pick up new skills quickly

- You have the ability to understand and follow verbal & written instructions, policies & rules, and to request

assistance when needed

- You are able to perform basic math skills to accurately count money and make change

- You are able to work well with others to help create a strong and cooperative team

 

EOE | Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity | DFWP | Background checks will be required prior to beginning employment.

https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/916370.name: Medical Assistant
https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/916370.description:
Job Description

- Assist with patient preparation and positioning during fluoroscopic procedures as directed by the provider.

- Ensure the patient signs proper consent for the procedure they are having.

- Take Pre and Post-Op Vitals. Able to start an IV and administer medications through an IV.

- Perform routine specialized procedures under direction of the physician.

- Perform sterilization of equipment by way of cold sterilization techniques as well as an autoclave.

- Maintain equipment and maintenance & testing logs for equipment

- Maintain stocks of medicines and medical supplies as necessary for pain procedures.

- Prepares procedure & exam rooms for the clinician before scheduled patients’ appointments.

- During Pre and Post Op calls, educate patients on specified medical issues within established parameters. Report any concerns to the provider immediately.

- Assist and escort patients to the examination room.

- Review patient history, current medical problems, and reason for procedure/visit.

- Document all information given by the patient to be available to the physician.

- Follow the directions of the physician and assist with any procedures as deemed by the physician.

- Assist patients with questions or concerns regarding their treatment under the supervision of the physician.

- Works independently while understanding the necessity for communicating and coordinating work efforts with other employees and management.

- Informs management of any potential issues about the safety of patients and other employees.

- Maintains the strictest confidentiality; adheres to all HIPAA guidelines/regulations.

- Interacts professionally with other employees, patients, and suppliers.

- Maintain the cleanliness and adequate supplies of the procedure room and designated areas.

- Willing to cross-train and learn in other areas of the Clinic.

KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS

- Must be organized and detail-oriented.

- Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and prioritize tasks.

- Excellent communication skills.

- Knowledge of medical / surgical terminology

- Knowledge of scribing and using an EMR - We are currently using Athena

- Knowledge of standard office procedures and equipment.

- Ability to take regular direction from physicians.

- Demonstrate a strong commitment and dedication to attendance and self-improvement.

EDUCATION AND WORK EXPERIENCE

- High School Diploma or equivalent.

- 1-2 years of similar job experience in a medical office preferred.

- 1-2 years Fluoroscopy experience. Operating a C-Arm preferred

WORKING CONDITIONS

·       Clinical Office Setting

·       There may be an occasional lifting of supplies up to 50 lbs.

·       Must be able to assist patients with standing, sitting, and getting on the examination table.

·       Must be able to stand, pivot & frequently walk throughout the workday.

·       Prolonged periods of sitting.

This position requires the ability to work independently and without close supervision. Position involves both work and site responsibilities.

Duties/Responsibilities

• Prepares calculations and reports related to land surveys, as well as prepares stakeout calculations using Carlson and AutoCAD

• Oversees the execution of stakeout / layout, site calibration, topographic, as-builts, ILCs, grade certifications, structural inspections and/or other related survey duties. Review and stamp final drawings

• Determines appropriate surveying techniques to be used on each project.

• Gathers survey data using TOPCON global positioning systems (GPS) and other surveying tools to map areas and measure angles, distances, and elevations.

• Ensures final maps display a comprehensive and accurate description of the field survey.

• Ensures all tasks are completed in a timely manner

• Completes any surveying tasks other employees are unable to complete.

• Performs other related duties as assigned.

• Must be willing to travel on a per diem bases

https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/918942.name: Dump Truck Driver
https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/918942.description:
Beck Construction & Excavation is looking to hire a CDL Truck Driver to drive a dump truck.

Our company prides itself on quality work, safety, and our reputation. We offer a great working environment, competitive wages, health insurance, dental, vision, retirement, life insurance, holiday pay and paid vacation.

Job Description:

- A CDL Truck Driver is a construction worker whose first priority should be safe operation and practices on and off job sites.

- The truck driver is responsible to transport equipment and to move large amounts of rock, dirt, concrete and other construction materials.

- When not driving, truck drivers are required to remain on the job-site and assist other crew members with tasks.

Expectations:

- The CDL Driver is responsible to know, understand and oblige by all FMCSA rules and regulations.

- The CDL Truck Driver is expected to maintain their vehicles and provide general maintenance as needed on their vehicle, for safe operations on the Highway and construction job-sites. This maintenance may include, but is not limited to, the following: > Accurate Daily Walk a rounds each morning > Changing Light bulbs > Checking air pressures in truck and trailer(s) > Changing oil and general greasing of the vehicle(s) > Keep the interior and exterior of the vehicle(s) clean of trash, debris and mud > Completing repair orders for any maintenance done to and/or parts purchased for the machinery.

- The CDL Truck Driver is required to grease and wash their own truck.

Required License or Certification:

- Class A CDL, no restrictions

- Must know how to operate 18 speed manual transmissions

- Secure loading materials for safe transportation including tarping and some load rearranging

- Deliver and dump materials on level and secure ground

- Communicate regularly with dispatcher to ensure timely product delivery at job site

- Observe and report equipment or mechanical failures immediately

- Conduct daily inspections of the vehicle at the beginning and end of each shift and report any problems or damage to management

- Comply with all DOT and in-house regulations and rules

Requirements:

- Class A CDL License in good standing

- Medical Card

- No serious tickets or accidents in last 3 years

- Must be able to lift and maneuver up to 75 lbs

Benefits include:

- Excellent wages and production bonuses

- Medical / Dental / Vision insurance packages

- Retirement plans

- Paid Time Off (PTO) plan

- Safety bonus incentive

Our company is committed to being trusted voices of light and truth reaching hundreds of millions of people worldwide.

Bonneville International has been a leader in broadcasting for over 50 years, with a mission to build up, connect, inform and celebrate communities and families across our markets. We currently own and operate 22 radio stations in Seattle, Phoenix, Denver, Sacramento, San Francisco and Salt Lake City, along with the NBC Affiliate TV station, KSL TV 5, in Salt Lake. We're proud of our history, and we want talented people to join us as we continue to grow! KSL TV is looking for an on-call video editor to join their team. You would be responsible to edit video per the needs of KSL News Services and meet the professional editing standards and deadlines set by KSL News Services. Job emphasis is on news editing, with some lifestyle editing as well. Regular shift is M-F mornings starting at 3:00 AM, but is subject to change based on the needs of the Company.

Overview

 As a patient-focused organization, University of Utah Health exists to enhance the health and well-being of people through patient care, research and education. Success in this mission requires a culture of collaboration, excellence, leadership, and respect. University of Utah Health seeks staff that are committed to the values of compassion, collaboration, innovation, responsibility, diversity, integrity, quality and trust that are integral to our mission. EO/AA

 The position is responsible for creating the Starbucks Beverage experience working in a high volume, fast paced unit serving professional clientele. This position is not responsible for providing patient care.

 Corporate Overview: The University of Utah is a Level 1 Trauma Center and is nationally ranked and recognized for our academic research, quality standards and overall patient experience. Our four hospitals and seventeen clinics provide excellence in our comprehensive services, medical advancement, and overall patient outcomes.

 - Submit a full application process online at employment.utah.edu

 - Upload most recent up dated resume with verifiable work history and experience.

 - Review Job Location, Schedule Hours and Qualifications to be consider for this job.

 - If your phone number or email changes make sure to update it in your original application.

 - If selected, We will do a phone screen and consider you for a formal interview.

 Responsibilities

 - Serves as a representative of both the organization and Starbucks Corporation, providing the best beverage experience possible.

 - Ensures that beverages are made to Starbucks standards and recipes, and according to the customer's request.

 - Processes cash, credit card payments or phone pay and gives accurate change, as necessary.

 - Adheres to strict guidelines for product date tagging, rotating, and cleaning of work area.

 - Appropriately displays and sells bottled beverages, sandwiches and snacks.

 - Restocks and cleans work area.

 Knowledge / Skills / Abilities

 - Ability to perform the essential functions of the job as outlined above.

 - Ability to certify as a Starbucks Barista in the allotted training time and demonstrate to the trainer proper writing and calling back of drinks to the customer.

 - Demonstrated basic math and cash register skills.

 - Demonstrated communications and human relations skills.

 - Ability to appropriately handle issues associated with the operation including customer service, cash handling, and stocking of supplies, with minimal direct supervision.

 - Ability to perform and/or coordinate the activities of others to ensure proper functioning when operating under conditions of staff shortages.

 Qualifications

 Qualifications Required

 - Six months of food service, customer service experience, or equivalency.

 - Current Food Handlers work permit within one month of hire.

 - Successful completion of Barista training within one month of hire.

 Licenses Required

 - One of the following

 - Current Utah Food Handler Permit.

 - Current Food Protection Manager certification, accredited by ANSI.

 * Additional license requirements as determined by the hiring department.

 Qualifications (Preferred)

 Working Conditions and Physical Demands

 Employee must be able to meet the following requirements with or without an accommodation.

This position may be subject to chemical and equipment hazards and is standing and walking for sustained periods of time.

 Carrying, Climbing, Color Determination, Crawling, Far Vision, Lifting, Listening, Manual Dexterity, Near Vision, Pulling and/or Pushing, Reaching, Sitting, Speaking, Standing, Stooping and Crouching, Tasting or Smelling, Walking
