 This position prepares a variety of food service items by following established hospital recipes and procedures. Incumbents may be given the responsibility to lead the activities of other cooks and perform advanced duties associated with the preparation and cooking of food products. The position is not responsible for providing patient care.

 Corporate Overview: The University of Utah is a Level 1 Trauma Center and is nationally ranked and recognized for our academic research, quality standards and overall patient experience.  Responsibilities

 - Bakes, roasts, stews, fries, steam-cooks, or otherwise prepares food products for cooking by following instructions and standard hospital recipes.

 - Utilizes knowledge of cooking methods and preparation time requirements to ensure that adequate amounts of properly prepared foods are provided in a timely fashion. Uses cooking knowledge and experience to adjust recipes for factors such as altitude, special diet orders, etc.

 - Adheres to manufacturer instructions and standard hospital kitchen procedures when operating machinery and equipment used in cooking including slicers, choppers, steamers, broilers, griddles, fryers, braziers, blenders, microwaves, etc.

 - Weighs cooking products, as required, ensuring proper portion delivery.

 - Cleans the work area, refrigerators, stoves, ovens, storeroom, and utensils in order to comply with hospital, county and state sanitation requirements.

 - Performs quality checks for taste and appearance of finished food products.

 - Uses department-specific computer software and daily menus to complete purchase and issue requisitions and to forecast cooking production for the cafeteria, catering, day care area, and patient needs.

 - Sets up and stocks area for food service delivery and assists in serving cooked items.

 - Orders, rotates, and maintains adequate stock levels required for cooking production by estimating needs according to the production schedule.

 - Assists in completing all aspects of cooking production to ensure that ordered items are delivered on time.

 - Assists with catering functions including food preparation, set-up, presentation and clean-up.

 - May develop, modify, or experiment with hospital recipes and cooking procedures to improve kitchen output or services.

 Knowledge / Skills / Abilities

 - Ability to perform the essential functions of the job as outlined above.

 - Demonstrated human relations, computer literacy, and effective communication skills.

 - Ability to organize and facilitate functions with minimal notice.

 - Knowledge of cost-control methods and prioritization for timely delivery and service.

 - Knowledge of operating heavy mechanized equipment including slicers, mixers, blenders, steam kettles, fryers, and choppers.

 - Ability to comply with departmental policies regarding attendance and evaluations.

 Qualifications

 Qualifications Required

 - Two years of institutional cooking experience, or equivalency.

 Licenses Required

 - One of the following

 - Current Utah Food Handler Permit.

 - Current Food Protection Manager certification, accredited by ANSI.

 * Additional license requirements as determined by the hiring department.

 Qualifications (Preferred)

 Preferred

 - Previous food production experience in a health care setting.

 - Previous supervisory experience may be preferred for some positions.

 Working Conditions and Physical Demands

 Employee must be able to meet the following requirements with or without an accommodation.

 - This position involves intermediate working conditions in a healthcare setting that may exert up to 50 pounds and may consistently require lifting, carrying, pushing, pulling, or otherwise moving equipment or objects. This position is subject to hot or cold temperatures and may be subject to hazards with equipment or cleaning chemicals.

 - We are University of Utah Health. Employment.utah.edu

 Physical Requirements

 Carrying, Climbing, Color Determination, Crawling, Far Vision, Lifting, Listening, Manual Dexterity, Near Vision, Pulling and/or Pushing, Reaching, Sitting, Speaking, Standing, Stooping and Crouching, Tasting or Smelling, Walking

 This position performs various cleaning tasks to provide all staff, visitors and patients a safe and clean environment. The incumbent maintains high standards of cleanliness, sanitation and freedom from hazards and infections. This position has the authority to experience a certain degree of autonomy in simply "keeping up" an assigned area under their jurisdiction, making independent judgments on needed activities and projects. Incumbents may function as a team leader on specific assignments or activities involving personnel of the same job classification. Challenges encountered in this position include working around patients, visitors and staff without causing any disruptions, working with patient care units and other departments with specialized cleaning needs and hazards, and determining if chemical spills are medical, infectious or a routine spill and then the appropriate procedure to follow in disposing of the spill. This position is not responsible for providing patient care.

 - Operates and maintains electric floor machines, snow blowers, industrial vacuums, carpet shampooing equipment and upholstery shampooing equipment.

 - Cleans, refinishes and maintains a variety of floor coverings.

 - Labels and removes infectious waste bags and containers.

https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/901517.description:
Looking for "the next big thing?" Well this is it! Are you wanting a chance to earn unlimited income WITH stability?

Receive a salary (plus commission!) in real estate while serving as an inside sales agent (ISA). To be specific, this is MUCH more of a service role than it is a sales role. This role involves leadership, management, a great eye for detail, a strong commitment to systems and a friendly/personable demeanor on the phone.

There's no better way to create great wealth in a vibrant culture!

The inside service/sales agent (ISA) serves as a hybrid of roles.

- Must possess exceptional phone skills and be unafraid to talk to anyone (we'll teach you the things to say and the questions to ask).

- Must be extremely detail oriented and dedicated to systems.

- Must be willing to have accountability conversations on a regular basis.

- Must be hyper-focused on meeting and exceeding goals through conversations with potential clients.

- Must have a desire for a big life.

We're not interested in someone who just wants to sell houses. We're interested in someone who loves making connections and doesn't want the audacious night/weekend schedule that pulls you out of your home.

A great ISA has thicker skin - a superb eye for detail - and is passionate to make an impact on their world.

If you crave being in a vivacious workplace and you want a big life, then this could be the place for you.

Note - Hard work will be handsomely rewarded. Also, know that we hire on character and we can train skill... so let's talk!

Compensation

$30,000 - $150,000/yr. Base salary + commission!

About Utah Life Real Estate Group

Utah Life Companies consist of:

- Utah Life Real Estate Group (based in Farmington and Serving All Of Utah)

- METAu - Coaching Across the US

Utah Life is in the business of helping people - we just happen to sell real estate. The Utah Life is a top real estate team in Utah

These are the greatest places on earth to work. The energy is contagious - the people are incredible - and the opportunity for growth is unmatched.

https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/918562.description:
If you are looking for a supplemental income or a part-time time job that doesn't interfere with your daytime classes or daytime job and is low stress, this is for you! This is a great way to pay off debt faster or save toward a financial goal! We are currently hiring an individual to clean the Lindquist Mortuary in Ogden, UT every Mon/Tue/Sat/*Sun evening with one other male. *Sundays are occasional. The ideal candidate will have some flexibility on these evenings each week, as we don't know more than 3 days ahead of time whether we can start cleaning as early as 6:00 pm or as early as 8:30 pm. Each shift is 2 hours. *1 hour on Sundays nights. Many of our employees are stay-at-home-moms, college students, couples, and working professionals looking to earn a supplemental income. We provide a company culture where employees feel supported and valued! All training and supplies/equipment are provided. 

Work Schedule

https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/917665.description:
OSPREY IS HIRING! If you love adventure, great gear, and have a passion for the outdoors, you're in good company at Osprey. We are accepting applications for Warehouse Associate at our Distribution Center in Ogden, Utah.

What You'll Do

This is an entry-level position. No experience required. Daily responsibilities may change depending on the particular needs of the Distribution Center – including receiving, cycle counts, return to inventory, sales order fulfillment, and warehouse maintenance.

Is This You?

- You care about being a part of a team and bring positivity to the workplace

- You are a learner and open to constructive feedback to continuously improve your skills

- You are able to manage tasks in compliance with company policies and operating procedures

Visit Osprey's Career Center at www.osprey.com/careers for complete list of Qualifications

Our Purpose & Core Values

We relentlessly innovate to ease your journey and inspire adventure

- INNOVATION: We have no patience for those who say "impossible"      

- INTEGRITY: We choose candor, humility and honesty. The path we seek always points positive       

- QUALITY: Our promise is built on a bedrock of quality. We believe loyalty is continuously earned and we stand behind what we do        

- RESPECT: Our community is open and inclusive to all. Our differences fuel our strengths       

- STEWARDSHIP: We have a duty of care for the people, places, and things we touch; we are steadfast in our resolve to leave our world better than we found it

Osprey's Perk & Benefits

- Pay Range: The approximate hiring salary range for this role is $14.25/hr - $14.50/hr. Final compensation may vary from posted hiring range based upon work experience, education, and/or skill level, as well as internal equity and alignment with market data

- Share in our Success:  Eligible for Profit Sharing and Osprey’s Company Appreciation Plan

- Paid Time Off (PTO): 14 Days PTO to start, 9 Paid Holidays plus 2 Floating Holidays, as well as Volunteer and Outings Paid Time-off

- We offer a comprehensive and competitive benefits program. Check out our website at www.osprey.com/careers for a summary

https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/918641.name: Funding Analyst
https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/918641.description:
TITLE:                          Funding Analyst

REPORTS TO:              Director of Funding

FLSA STATUS:            Non-Exempt

POSITION SUMMARY:

This is an opportunity to enter the financial services industry, learning the critical components of the consumer loan process from application for credit to supporting loan documentations and stipulations through funding. This is a vital role to safeguard the integrity of the business and presents the perfect portal for a wonderful career path in a lucrative industry. The right candidate will be ambitious to learn from the ground up all the intricacies necessary to develop into a credit analyst or a leadership role in our funding department.  We provide you the opportunity and you determine your level of success.

Funding Analyst roles are widely ranged within the verifications of credit application information including customers identity, monthly income, address verifications, and much more. Attention to micro detail is imperative for this position. Accuracy in data entry is vital. You will enjoy interacting with our wonderful team as well as our customers and external corporations like insurance companies.   

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: 

- Communication with clients, vendors and customers

- Verifying the accuracy of documents.

- Verifying the accuracy of income calculations

- Data entry into our Loan Operating System

- Answer inbound inquiries via messaging systems and phones, etc

- Reconciliation of customer applications and contracts.

- Preparing and mailing client statements.

- Other duties as assigned

QUALIFICATIONS:

All employees must adhere to the below Company Values:

Develop employees through continuous training

Respect and keep promises to customers and coworkers

Intently listen to understand customer needs

Value honesty, transparency, and consistency in all of our dealings

Experts at finding simple solutions

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  Applicants must be 18 years or older and be authorized to work in the U.S., have a valid driver license and professional appearance.

EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE:

- High school graduate or equivalent. 

- Must be able to multi-task.

- Ability to understand and follow directions

- Basic computer skills

- Strong organizational skills

COMPUTER SKILLS:

Sound computer skills including basic internet & Microsoft Office Products with the ability to type 40 words per minute

PHYSICAL DEMANDS:

While performing the duties of this job the employee is regularly required to sit; stand; walk; use hands to finger, handle, or feel; reach with hands and arms and talk or hear. The employee may be required to lift up to 25 pounds.

WORK ENVIRONMENT:

Mostly office environment.  Will use office machines such as copier, fax, printer, computers, phones, etc.

NOTE:

This is not necessarily an exhaustive list of responsibilities, skills, duties, requirements, efforts or working conditions associated with this job.  While this list is intended to be an accurate reflection of the current job, the Company reserves the right to revise the functions and duties of the job and to require that additional or different tasks be performed as circumstances dictate.

Considering a career with Ken Garff Automotive Group means you are in for a great ride (excuse the car metaphor)! - Competitive compensation package

- Great people with a great culture

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer

https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/918369.name: QuickBooks Online Bookkeeper Needed For Outsourced Accounting Service $40k - $50k
https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/918369.description:
SLC Bookkeeping is currently looking for a QuickBooks Online Bookkeeper to join their growing team of business accounting and support staff. 

 This is a remote position. You are required to have a quiet dedicated professional workspace and reliable high-speed internet.

 Our staff is:

1.    Passionate about working with and helping small businesses grow

2.    Technologically Innovative

3.    Customer Service Driven

4.    Self-motivated (rules/regulations/dress codes are not necessary for us to meet and exceed customer expectations)

 

Salt Lake Bookkeeping employees are not:

1.    Corporate Conformists

2.    Slaves to the Clock

3.    Boring

 

Our company is unified in its mission and maintains a unique company culture that believes in a balance between work and life, providing the flexibility to do what you love, while working hard to provide the best possible service to our clients. The most important objective is to do all you can to produce the most useful and accurate information for the client while having fun.

 

SLC Bookkeeping uses a completely paperless business platform to work on clients’ books. As a result, we appreciate individuals who are tech-savvy and or used to working in a dual-monitor environment. Excellent time management and organizational skills are essential to keep on top of the work for 20+ clients. Effective communication skills are essential, as you would be constantly working with clients, CPA’s, and team members.

The main job responsibilities of the position include (but are not limited to) the following:

      Reconciling bank, credit card, and loan statements from various financial institutions

      Integrating various apps with QuickBooks Online

      Coding expenses, AR & AP, QuickBooks deposits, etc.

      Managing your schedule to service multiple clients (15-30 clients simultaneously)

      Communicating with internal management regarding client progress

      Learning new bookkeeping procedures to take on new clients and projects

 

Skills we admire in a candidate include:

      Adaptable to new technology

      Motivated and driven to do what it takes to provide customers with excellent service

      The ability to problem solve independently

      Friendly with good communication skills and willing to ask questions

  

The ideal candidate will have the following experience:

      2+ years QuickBooks Online experience and bookkeeping experience with a small business

      Having simultaneously serviced multiple different types of businesses in QBO

      2-4 year degree or certification with a preference in business, accounting or finance

      A private and quiet home office

The starting salary for this position is $42,000 to $48,000. Benefits include health and dental insurance as well as a 401k with an employer match.

 

To apply, please submit your resume in PDF format along with a unique and interesting cover letter highlighting your education, bookkeeping experience, technology background, small business experience, and what you are passionate about.

https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/918635.description:
Company Introduction:

Chicken Salad Chick provides a delicious menu with a variety of 12 Chicken Salads, homemade sides, delicious soups, and great sandwiches. This location is one of the originals to the franchise and we are looking for a hospitality professional to help us maintain a team of excellence and superb service.Overview:

We have an opening for a Chicken Salad Chick Shift Lead position. The work schedule for this position will rotate to include a combination of opening, mid-shift, and closing. Please only apply if you are available to work these hours. Working at Chicken Salad Chick is more than just a job, it's an opportunity to gain valuable skills and life experience that goes beyond just serving a great product in a friendly environment.

Responsibilities:

- Serving guests by taking orders, handling cash and credit cards, making drinks and desserts by offering an immediate and respectful response to all guest's needs.

- Delivering meals to guests at their table or to a designated pick-up area, and providing excellent customer service at all times.

- Maintain cleanliness of your work area and the dining room, parking lot, and restrooms.

- Stock sauces, cups, lids, etc. as needed to maintain throughout your shift.

- Effectively manage and lead a team of people serving our guests while maintaining our operating standards to provide the best hospitality and guest experience.

- Making deliveries

- Coaching, teaching and training team members on policies and procedures and creating a positive work environment for everyone.

- Maintain food safety and cleanliness standards

- Open and/or close the restaurant leading the shift as a key holder

Requirements:

- You must be hard-working, team-oriented, friendly, honest and have great customer service skills.

- Reliable transportation with a current driver's license is required

- Be authorized to work in the United States

- Be at least 18 years old

- Must have a High School diploma or equivalent

- Be available to work any time including Saturdays- time off can be given for special requests

- Have at least one-year previous restaurant management or leadership experience is preferred.

- Excellent verbal and written communication skills

https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/918633.name: Manufacturing Technician-Rotating Day Shift (OLM)
https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/918633.description:
Manufacturing Formulation Technician

 NO EXPERIENCE NECESSARY – WE WILL TRAIN YOU, MULTIPLE POSITIONS AVAILABLE

 Oratech/Ultradent , the global name in oral health, is seeking manufacturing workers who are looking to advance in their career! Manufacturing Workers come join our Formulations Team as a Manufacturing Technician (also known as a Formulation Technician)! This is an entry level position. If you have manufacturing experience, we will train you to be a technician! Technicians will be responsible for the daily cleanliness of the formulation lab and corresponding equipment.

 We follow strict COVID-19 procedures including mandatory masks (provided), daily heath assessments, daily screening, and a work environment that allows for social distancing to keep you safe at work.

 This is a 12 hr. Rotating Day Shift from 5:00 am– 5:30 pm. schedule is working 2 days on, 2 days off and every other weekend.

 Why Work for OraTech:

 OraTech is a hard-working company focused on safety first for our people. Quality and delivery are also important to us when making and packaging our products. We're defined by our fast-paced environment dedicated to providing unique solutions as a high-speed, contract manufacturer. OraTech is a wholly owned subsidiary of Ultradent Products Inc. Don't take our word for it, see what our employees are saying: https://youtu.be/UGpDHCaZ_Yw

 Job Duties:

 -

 Responsible for the formulation of bulk liquid and semi-solid dental and oral health care products

 -

 Movement of raw materials from warehouses to manufacturing areas

 -

 Accurate measurement of chemical ingredients

 -

 Operation and cleaning of mixing, blending, and milling equipment

 - Documentation of manufacturing processes, both handwritten and electronic

 What we're looking for in you:

 -

 Ability to follow instructions

 -

 Ability to record and document critical batch process documents

 -

 Attention to accuracy and detail

 -

 Ability to work and cooperate with team members

 -

 Background in food, supplement, cosmetic, medical device, or pharmaceutical chemical formulation required

 -

 Familiar with measurement scales, mixing, blending, chemical mills and other formulation manufacturing equipment

 - Knowledge of FDA regulations, cGMP, and lean manufacturing

 Benefits and Perks you'll get at Ultradent:

 -

 Medical/Dental & Other Insurances (eligible the first of month after 60 days)

 -

 Health Savings with employer contribution

 -

 401K

 -

 On-site Fitness Center

 -

 Employee access to discounted Ultradent products

 -

 Five days paid between Christmas and New Years

 -

 Education Assistance

 Ultradent is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regards to race, color religion, sex, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.

 VEVRAA Federal Contractor: For more information please contact us at recruiting@ultradent.com .

 PWDNET

 #ORATECH

https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/918542.name: Utah Immigration Attorney New LawTech Opportunity
https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/918542.description:
MyImmigration is a new Utah-based immigration law firm with a belief that everyone deserves access to affordable and simple immigration services. We want to create an alternative to the low-cost-but-hazardous DIY approach, and the expensive-but-safe law firm option by creating the first digital native immigration law firm with technology as its beating heart.

Our legal technology (lawtech) platform enables you, our attorney, to focus only on providing immigration advice. We allow consumers to confidently complete a majority of their immigration application through an attorney-designed web-based application portal, of which the underlying technology has been used in thousands of immigration applications. This allows you to deliver professional advice only when it makes sense, and not at stages of the application process where the client is better positioned to contribute to their application.

We currently seek a lawyer to lead this innovative immigration practice in Utah. This is a great opportunity to join a team of technologists & lawyers using this emerging practice model that provides client-focused, technology-driven and low-cost alternatives to the traditional firm model.

As our attorney, you will handle primarily family based immigration, green card applications, DACA, and US citizenship files.

https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/918610.name: Pet Groomer
https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/918610.description:
Company Introduction:

At City Bark, we’ve spent years creating the perfect environment where your canine companions or feline friends can relax (or play) while you’re gone! As an award-winning, upscale daycare and boarding facility, we believe there’s no better way to show your furry friend how much you care than by pampering them to a day – or a few days – at one of our luxurious locations!Overview:

The Pet Groomer is a commission-based position within the Resort and reports directly to the General Manager. We believe in the mission of “Pet Lovers Delighting Pet Lovers” and we demonstrate this through being Playful, Passionate, Personal and Professional. A successful candidate for this position will be someone who not only embraces this culture, but is a team player, self-motivated, takes direction well, has excellent communication skills, and great attention to detail.This is a service-related industry and you should not only be skilled at customer service, but passionate about helping people. Most importantly, the candidate should have experience grooming or bathing all breeds of dogs and cats. Primary responsibilities are to ensure that all pets in your care receive a groom that is of professional quality that meets or exceeds the client’s request without ever compromising the physical and emotional health of the pet.

A Day in the Life:

This role is very important to our pets and their parents. You’re the one who makes them feel like a million bucks! Oftentimes, you are helping keep their pet healthy by maintaining a clean and well-groomed animal. Daily, you’ll work on both animals with reservations, walk-in appointments and some of our guests who are staying with us in boarding. You’ll perform a full groom, simple baths and touch ups and sometimes, the random “emergency-someone-just-peed-on-themselves-because-they-are-so-excited-bath.” You’ll not only communicate with the dog(s), but also have a lot of interaction with mom and dad. You’ll document what you are seeing - sometimes you’re the first to notice an issue and can help the parents solve a health concern. And let’s not forget -- you’re probably going to scoop some poop, clean up some pee, go home with some fur on you and get lots of sloppy kisses!

Responsibilities:

- Provide an overall positive experience for the pets as they are being groomed, including compassion, gentleness, reassurance, safety, and comfort. 

- Ensure that all guests are groomed or bathed (depending on the parent’s requests) to the parent’s specifications. Grooms/Baths must be completed on time. 

- Works with Resort Hosts to schedule or schedule grooming appointments yourself, including setting up new clients in online software and discussing vaccination protocol with both new and existing clients. 

- Meet and greet all grooming clients whenever possible to discuss grooming instructions after assessing the dog’s coat and condition. Meet with clients or communicate after groom on results, including providing report cards. Suggest any added services that would be beneficial to the client.

- Return all phone calls and emails in a timely manner. Grow your business by rescheduling any appointments.

- Ensure client satisfaction by resolving any customer service issues within your capabilities. 

- Properly maintain all grooming tools to insure quality of grooms. Check equipment on a regular basis to ensure it is not hazardous to guests.

- Promptly notify the manager if supplies are needed (bandana, shampoos, etc).

- Maintain a sanitary and healthy environment by following the resort’s standards of cleaning and disinfecting your workspace. See below for details. 

- Cleaning is essential: All hair must be swept off the floor in a timely manner. Bathing and drying rooms must be cleaned before going home. Grooming area must be tidy (windows cleaned, floor mopped, computer station cleaned.).

- Disinfecting drying rooms is crucial. Use disinfectant daily and bleach weekly on all drying rooms. 

- Monitor guest’s health while grooming or bathing. Report any unusual concerns to the general manager and the pet parent. 

- Ensure the guest has water and a chance to “go potty” if he or she will be with you for over 2 hours. 

- Follow all standards of safety with regards to handling guests, particularly aggressive guests and escape artists.

- Pay specific attention to kennel tags, (Meds Person to Feed, Aggressive, Separate for Feeding, etc).

- Adhere to pricing guidelines. Get prior approval from the manager or pet’s owner before any additional costs are added to service. 

- Effectively communicate to pet care staff that guests are with you.

- Adhere to procedures in identifying pets while they are with you (groom cards, name bands).

- Promptly give any laundry to pet care so that it can be cleaned. 

- Consult with other departments.

Work with a team who all exemplify these qualities:

- A passion for animals and animal care, especially dogs + cats. Willing to learn animal behavior to ensure their safety.

- Focuses on safe and gentle handling. Forceful, aversive, aggressive handling, vocalizing or treatment will not be tolerated.

- Customer Service Oriented - Ability to take care of the customers’ needs while following company procedures. Manages difficult or emotional customer situations; Responds promptly to customer needs; Responds to request for service and assistance. Build trust with customers.

- Willing and able to communicate directly with clients, both written and orally, about their dog. Works to make these “lifetime clients”.

- Must be able to work under conditions that require sitting, standing, walking, bending, reaching, pulling, pushing and grasping.

- Conflict Resolution - Ability to handle conflict with tact and diplomacy.

- Good team work and willingness to assist other departments as necessary.

- Cheerful, friendly, positive team-oriented attitude.

- Strong attention to detail, especially where documentation is concerned. Ability to work in computer systems such as Microsoft Office.

- Reliable, punctual, and dependable.

- Ability to work a flexible schedule, including holidays and weekends.

- Ability to take direction well and apply it independently. 

- Ability to work in temperature extremes, work outside, or in distracting work environments such as loud noise/sound.

- Ability to tolerate being in close contact with various bodily fluids and to get dirty frequently. 

- Physically able to handle dogs of all sizes and to lift up to 60 lbs. 

- Other duties as assigned.

Qualifications For This Position:

Education : Professional Grooming Certifications preferred but not required

Experience : 

- Two to four years professional grooming experience preferred

- Strong knowledge of individual breed standards and breed cuts

- Use of proper scissoring techniques

Equal Employment Opportunity:

NVA Pet Resorts is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer committed to diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, gender identity or any other factor protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.

https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/918608.description:
Company Introduction:

We are a regional franchise system started right here in Denver CO in 1985, We have over 30 locations in the Denver Metro region with most of those individually owned and operated.

What separates use from our competitors is our attention to quality with our award winning sauce made daily in our stores along with fresh dough and veggies made daily. We use a superior fresh not frozen mozzarella cheese.Overview:

Various Shifts Available

Our flexible schedule allows you to enjoy life outside of work but structured enough to be able to rely on a guaranteed income. No waiting for an app to send you on a delivery. Paid hourly even when you're not on a delivery!

Exceptional Drivers earn great tips and $1.25 per/order, plus hourly wages ($20-$25/hour total average and more for top performers).

We have fun at work and expect you to bring an outgoing and open attitude to work at all times!

Delivery Driver Expectations:

- Come to work with a positive attitude

- Provide excellent customer service at all times

- Deliver pizzas quickly and safely to customers in the DU area

- Take phone orders in a professional manner and be knowledgeable of current menu and specials

- Assist in preparation of all food, some box folding, restocking supplies as needed and some dish washing

- Show up to work on time for scheduled shifts

Requirements for Drivers:

- Must be at least 18 years of age

- Must have your own vehicle with a valid driver's license and Insurance

- Driving record: No DUI's in previous 5 years. No felonies involving a vehicle. - No more than two moving violations in the preceding three years.

- Must come to work timely in all weather conditions

- Positive attitude

- Strong work ethic

- Must work well with others

https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/918606.name: Quality Assurance Shop Floor-Day Rotating Shift (OLM)
https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/918606.description:
Quality Assurance Shop Floor

 Ultradent, the global name in oral health is seeking a Quality Assurance Shop Floor (QASF) to join OraTech's Quality Assurance team (a division of Ultradent). QASF is responsible for inspecting goods manufactured at Oratech during production to ensure they meet customer and regulatory requirements. The QASF works in a manufacturing environment. This is a 12-hour rotating shift with working hours from 5:00 AM to 5:30 PM, and includes working every other Fri, Sat, and Sun.

 WHY WORK WITH ULTRADENT/OraTech:

 Ultradent Products, Inc., is a collaborative and hard-working company with a 40-year history of innovation. Ours is a fun, fast-paced work environment dedicated to providing unique, solution-oriented products to dentists—and their patients—across the globe. Our company was built on a foundation of innovation, integrity, hard work, quality, and care, and we put those values into everything we do. We ask all colleagues to seek out the excluded, enhance the team, share feedback fearlessly, welcome feedback humbly, amplify all voices, and embrace our differences.

 At Oratech, we follow strict COVID-19 procedures including mandatory masks (provided), daily heath assessments, daily screening, and a work environment that allows for social distancing to keep you safe at work. In our toothpaste division our focus is Safety, Quality, then Delivery

 Job Duties:

 - Perform In-Process Checks hourly in a manufacturing environment to ensure customer and regulatory requirements are met

 - Complete and review controlled documentation for accuracy and completeness according to cGDP

 - Pull samples of material to be lab tested

 - Communicate quality critical events to machine operators and management

 - Make quality critical decisions in a fast-paced environment

 - Track and trend quality assurance actions

 - Perform investigations into quality events

 - Generate reports that can be shared with management

 - Adheres to gowning and safety requirements

 - Other tasks and duties as assigned

 WHAT YOU'LL NEED TO SUCCEED:

 - Attention to detail

 - Ability to work independently and complete daily tasks, with little to no supervision.

 - An understanding of cGMP's to ensure proper documentation and process practices in an operations environment.

 - Experience with Microsoft Office including Outlook, Word, and Excel

 - Experience with QMS and ERP systems

 - The ability to learn new programs and software when required.

 - Ability to communicate effectively (email, in-person, etc.) including collaboration with multiple departments and management.

 - Ability to stand for long periods of time

 - Ability to lift up to 50 pounds frequently

 WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR IN YOU:

 - Prior experience in a manufacturing environment

 - Experience within a quality assurance is preferred

 - Problem solving skills in a high paced and fast changing environment

 - Ability to adapt to changes

 - Ability to multitask

 - Strong verbal and writing skills

 - Strong attention to detail

 WHAT BENEFITS AND PERKS YOU'LL GET W ITH ULTRADENT:

 - Medical/Dental & Other Insurances (eligible the first of month after 60 days)

 - Health Savings Account with employer contribution

 - 401K Plan with employer matching contribution

 - Employee access to discounted Ultradent products

 - Excellent paid time off (PTO) and “Medical Time Off (MTO) account to support medial and military events

 - Five days paid between Christmas and New Years

 - Education Assistance

 - Fun casual work environment

 Ultradent is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. We are a global culture where differences are sought after, welcomed, and embraced. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regards to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.

 VEVRAA Federal Contractor: For more information please contact us at recruiting@ultradent.com .

https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/918605.name: Dishwasher
https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/918605.description:
Overview

 As a patient-focused organization, University of Utah Health exists to enhance the health and well-being of people through patient care, research and education. Success in this mission requires a culture of collaboration, excellence, leadership, and respect. University of Utah Health seeks staff that are committed to the values of compassion, collaboration, innovation, responsibility, diversity, integrity, quality and trust that are integral to our mission. EO/AA

 This position is responsible for maintaining sanitation and cleaning of all areas of the department including kitchen, dining room and service areas while maintaining proper food safety measures. This position is also responsible for stocking patient tray line areas and assembling meal trays. The individual may also assist in the pre-meal preparation of meal service. This position has no responsibility for providing care to patients.

 Corporate Overview: The University of Utah is a Level 1 Trauma Center and is nationally ranked and recognized for our academic research, quality standards and overall patient experience. Our four hospitals and seventeen clinics provide excellence in our comprehensive services, medical advancement, and overall patient outcomes.

 - Submit a full application process online at employment.utah.edu

 - Upload most recent up dated resume with verifiable work history and experience.

 - Review Job Location, Schedule Hours and Qualifications to be consider for this job.

 - If your phone number or email changes make sure to update it in your original application.

 - If selected, We will do a phone screen and consider you for a formal interview 43448

 Responsibilities

 - Washes dishes and pots using dish washing equipment, cleans assigned areas and equipment daily, mops floors and performs other light cleaning duties as assigned.

 - Completes cleaning duties as assigned, including deep cleaning of work areas.

 - Removes waste and recyclables from department using access to loading dock and compactor.

 - Sets up food assembly areas, including the patient tray line, and performs other prep duties required to ensure well-coordinated food production and delivery.

 - Prepares food according to instructions written in standardized recipes. Portions and packages food in a timely and sanitary fashion.

 - Rotates, distributes and puts away stock as directed by department.

 - Maintains proper food safety measures.

 - Participates as part of team to ensure prompt and accurate delivery of food service.

 Knowledge / Skills / Abilities

 - Ability to perform the essential functions of the job as outlined above.

 - Demonstrated human relations and effective communication skills.

 - Demonstrated knowledge of operating mechanized equipment including slicer, mixer, and dishwasher.

 Qualifications

 Qualifications Required

 - Current Food Handler permit within one month of hire.

 Licenses Required

 - One of the following

 - Current Food Protection Manager certification, accredited by ANSI.

 - Current Utah Food Handler Permit.

 * Additional license requirements as determined by the hiring department.

 Qualifications (Preferred)

 Preferred

 - Previous dish washing experience.

 Working Conditions and Physical Demands

 Employee must be able to meet the following requirements with or without an accommodation.

 - This position involves intermediate working conditions in a healthcare setting that may exert up to 50 pounds and may consistently require lifting, carrying, pushing, pulling, or otherwise moving patients or objects, such as medical equipment, while providing patient care. This position may be subject to chemical and equipment hazards and is standing and walking for sustained periods of time.

 - Incumbents may face exposure to potentially dangerous cleaning chemicals utilized in sanitation procedures as well as equipment/supply hazards such wet or hot work surfaces and sharp edges on food wrap containers or open cans, meat slicers and food processors. The position involves lifting and/or pushing heavy supply containers, equipment and food carts. Incumbents also face exposure to items discarded on patient and customer trays, including soiled bandages and tubing, spilled medications, bodily fluids, and patient care equipment such as used needles, clamps and scissors.

 - We are University of Utah Health. Employment.utah.edu

 Physical Requirements

 Carrying, Color Determination, Lifting, Manual Dexterity, Pulling and/or Pushing, Reaching, Standing, Stooping and Crouching, Walking

 EEO Statement

 The University of Utah Health Care is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity employer. Upon request, reasonable accommodations in the application process will be provided to individuals with disabilities. The University of Utah Health Care is committed to diversity in its workforce. Women and minorities are encouraged to apply.

https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/918604.name: Loan Processor / Office Manager - 4 day work week Wed.-Saturday!
https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/918604.description:
Experience in Auto Finance or Loan Processing is helpful but NOT required. Happy to train someone detail-oriented and interested in a long term position. $20-23 per hr. Health Insurance coverage. 7 years work experience in any field(s) required.

Looking for someone to head our financing, paperwork, and title processes. Must become a subject matter expert on those processes in order to get deals printed, funded, and give a great customer experience during the sign-up process. Wanting someone to start ASAP.

4 day work weeks - you would have Sunday, Monday, and Tuesday off.

Utah Used Car Sales is a dealership that sells quality used cars at value prices. We do things a bit differently and have our sales people work with the customers to finalize all products and get the final OTD price and then you would take over with the paperwork from there.

MAIN DUTIES:

- Manage all finance paperwork and duties to complete all deals and receive funding

- Print sales paperwork and loan paperwork for each sale processed

- Work directly with customers to explain and walk through signing all paperwork to finalize the sell

- Become a subject matter expert on the financing and funding paperwork details while building relationships with the credit unions we work with through CUDL (Credit Union Direct Lending)

- Complete and Manage Customer's vehicle Registrations and Titles

PAY: $40,000 - $45,000 yearly. This is a salaried position, not commission based, but there are opportunities to make commission at times.

BENEFITS:

- Health Insurance coverage after 60 day of Employment – Platinum coverage with options for $500 to $2,000 Deductible.

- A Manager Company Car may be available after 90 days of positive employment reviews

- 4 day work weeks, 3 days off are Sunday, Monday, Tuesday

HOURS: This is a Full time position, 40+ hours, 4 day work weeks

SCHEDULE: Example: 9:30-10:00am to 6:30-8 pm Wednesday-Saturday (Get Sunday, Monday, and Tuesday off). SATURDAY IS ALWAYS REQUIRED. With 3 day weekends you should not expect to get additional time off often.

ADDITIONAL DUTIES WHEN NEEDED:

- Answer Phone Calls – Answer basic questions about vehicle availability and take messages for detailed vehicle questions

- Greet customers if a salesperson is unavailable

- Miscellaneous dealership duties as needed

REQUIREMENTS:

- Must be Detail Oriented.

- Must be able to get approved for a Utah Salesperson License and a Limited Lines Producer License

- High School Graduate. Additional Certificates and/or College is a plus, but not required.

- Office management/finance skills preferred, at minimal a good understanding of computers is required.

- Good customer service skills – friendly with customers and coworkers

- Minimum of 18 years old and a current, valid driver’s license with an acceptable driving record

- This position requires the ability to bend, kneel, sit, walk or stand for long periods of time

- This is a Drug Free Workplace

Offers of employment are contingent upon successfully passing a background screening including a criminal background check, a review of motor vehicle records, verification of social security number and passing drug tests. This is a Drug Free Workplace. You must be legal to work in the United States. You must be able to get a Utah Limited Lines License for products sold at the dealership.

https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/899887.description:
AVI Systems, Utah’s premier provider of smart home systems (we’ve been in business for 20 years!), is looking to hire Low Voltage Technicians in our Draper office due to growth. There are hundreds of new homes being built in Utah and demand for our services has never been greater. AVI technicians install home audio and theater, central vacuums, networking, automation, and other high-tech equipment for some of the Salt Lake Valley’s most beautiful homes. Technicians are responsible for the rough-in and trim of low voltage wires and equipment on new construction homes. Duties will also include wiring commercial locations, retrofitting existing homes and wall mounting TVs.

If you have a basic knowledge of pre-wiring and termination of low voltage wires, we will train you on the job to become a highly-skilled technician. Applicants should have a clean driving record, be able to lift and carry 75 pounds, have experience with basic hands tools (including use of a tape measure, hammer, screwdriver, snips, drill, etc.) and low voltage wires and be detailed-oriented in order to read and follow basic instructions and floor plans.  

AVI’s starting wage is $15.00/hour (a higher wage may be offered for more experienced technicians). AVI offers paid holidays, paid time off, health insurance and a company-sponsored 401k retirement plan. We have a fun work environment and a great, professional team that enjoys working together.

https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/917136.name: Water Truck Driver- Smithfield, UT
https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/917136.description:
Position Overview

 This is a skilled position involving the safe and efficient operation of Water Trucks. Drivers will deliver water to dirt crews. Paving crews and pit areas for dust control and grade work.

Key Responsibilities (Essential Duties and Functions)

- Can operate equipment safely and efficiently.

- Must keep time and material records.

- Must follow verbal and written instruction.

- Knowledge of different types material and grades they are spraying.

- Ability for maneuvering and backing.

- Must be able to communicate effectively on the radio system.

Qualifications

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Any requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skills and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Education/Experience

- High school diploma or general education degree (GED) required; and two years related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.

Certificates, License, Registrations

- Must possess a valid state commercial driver’s license (CDL) Class A with tanker endorsement. 

- Must possess a valid Medical Card as per DOT standard.

Work Requirements

- One to two years related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience

- Incident free driving record preferred

- May be subject drug and alcohol, medical exams and physical agilities testing.

Knowledge/Skill Requirements

- Ability to communicate using two-way radio.

- Basic math

- Basic computer skills preferred

Key Competencies

- Customer Service - Manages difficult or emotional customer situations; Responds promptly to customer needs.

- Teamwork - Contributes to building a positive team spirit.

- Judgment - Exhibits sound and accurate judgment.

- Planning/Organizing - Uses time efficiently.

- Professionalism - Approaches others in a tactful manner; Reacts well under pressure; Accepts responsibility for own actions.

- Safety and Security - Observes safety and security procedures; Determines appropriate action beyond guidelines; Reports potentially unsafe conditions; Uses equipment and materials properly.

- Adaptability - Adapts to changes in the work environment; Changes approach or method to best fit the situation; Able to deal with frequent change, delays, or unexpected events.

- Attendance/Punctuality - Is consistently at work and on time.

- Dependability - Follows instructions, responds to management direction; Commits to long hours of work when necessary to reach goals.

- Initiative - Asks for and offers help when needed.

- Innovation - Generates suggestions for improving work.

- Quality - Demonstrates accuracy and thoroughness; Looks for ways to improve and promote quality; Applies feedback to improve performance

- Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out detailed, but uninvolved written or oral instructions.

Physical Requirements

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.

The employee is frequently required to sit, climb, and use hands to signal and handle equipment. The employee is occasionally required to stand, walk, crawl, kneel, bend, and reach with hands and arms above their shoulders. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move anywhere up to 50-75 lbs. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision and depth perception.

 

Work Environment

The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is occasionally exposed to wet and/or humid conditions; moving mechanical parts; outside weather conditions; and extreme cold and/or heat. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.

The statements included in this job description are not intended to be all-inclusive. They represent typical elements and criteria necessary to successfully perform the job. Other duties may be assigned as required. Requirements for this job are subject to modification by the Company and its designees, and reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions

https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/918549.name: Escape Specialist
https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/918549.description:
POSITION TITLE: Escape Specialist - Seasonal

REPORTING TO: Hub Manager / Area Manager

COMPANY: Escape Campervans USA (www.escapecampervans.com)

ESCAPE CAMPERVANS is a unique and fast-growing travel company that rents custom-built campervans across North America. We provide a budget-friendly, functional and fun vehicle for weekends away, cross-country road trips, and everything in between. Perfect for couples, families, and friends, we strive to inspire adventure and exploration off-the-beaten path. Our teams have local knowledge and expertise to help our renters get the most out of their vacation, and all of our vans are custom built inhouse and hand-painted by local artists in LA.

With roots in New Zealand, Escape USA was founded in 2009 out of a garage in Los Angeles. Fast forward 12 years and we now have 600+ vans across 12 locations in North America – LA, SF, Seattle, Denver, Las Vegas, New York, Phoenix, Orlando, Calgary, Vancouver, Portland and Salt Lake City, with more locations to come. We are an energetic, inspired, and entrepreneurial team. We have a passion for travel and believe in the power of adventure – and we all hustle and wear a lot of hats.

Seasonal Escape Specialist

The Escape Specialist at all locations will be a crucial member of the team and will be touching every piece of the Escape experience. In this position, you will be supported by your Area Manager/Manager and our home office in Denver, while managing the entire process of prepping, cleaning and troubleshooting vans in preparation for customers’ vanlife adventures. The job picks up tremendously in our peak season (May thru Oct) and there may be opportunities for more hours based on volume needs.

If you have a love for the outdoors and are looking to work for the leading campervan rental company in North America with long-term career opportunities, this might be the perfect fit for you.

POSITION SUMMARY

Escape Campervans is growing very quickly which means we get a LOT of inbound interest. We are looking for an Escape Specialist to join our team! We need the right person to be the welcoming friendly face of our brand, to answer any and all questions, get customers excited about their upcoming trip and provide top-notch customer service. We also need this person to address and solve any customer issues that arise with urgency and professionalism. The other key component of this role is overseeing the readiness of our campervans. This position ensures vans are cleaned, detailed and serviced up to company standards. This individual is responsible for ensuring proper functionality of all elements of the campervan fit out such as the sink, refrigerators, lights, stove, and other components to confirm campervans are road ready. This role is extremely hands-on – don’t expect to spend much time sitting behind a computer at a desk!

Our campervans are as much hotels on wheels as they are vehicles. They have bedding, kitchen tables, curtains, and lots of nooks and crannies which get exposed to the elements while on camping trips. If you have housekeeping/hotel experience, this might be a great fit for you!

RESPONSIBILITIES

Include but not limited to the following:

• Ensure all vans are prepped and ready for pickup

• Schedule pickup times with the guests

• Work with local mechanic and dealership partners to complete regular preventative

maintenance checks

• Problem-solve, schedule and fix van and customer service issues when they arise

• Keep depot clean, tidy and professional

• Always follow the company brand manifesto and brand values

• Follow all company COVID-19 safety protocols

Customer Pickup & Dropoff

• Complete checklist to ensure campervans are ready for customer pick up – fully stocked, safety

checks, cleaned and previous renter feedback addressed

• Offer travel tips, campsite and itinerary questions

• Perform a detailed van review upon drop off: eg. check for damage, troubleshoot problems,

help dispose of trash/leftovers

Campervan Prep

• Detailed cleaning of the interior & exterior of the campervan immediately upon return

• Prepping the campervan prior to a rental

• Wash dishes

• Fold laundry

• Fill water tanks

• Set up kits and ensure all items are properly included in the rental according to the reservation

• Preform final touch before pickup

Light Mechanical

• Fluid top offs

• Tire pressure checks and top ups

• Fridge Battery/Solar panel check

• Water pump check

• Ensure full tank of gas

• Interior repairs (eg curtains)

• Wiper blade replacement

REQUIREMENTS:

• Hard worker

• Attention to detail

• Positive, engaging attitude

• Must be able to work weekends, nights & holidays

• Self-starter.

• Demonstrates ability to work independently in stressful situations

• Must be able to pass a background check

QUALIFICATIONS:

• High School Graduate, Associates Degree or higher preferred

• 1-3 years of previous work experience desired

• Outdoor industry/hotel experience desired

• Guide, resorts, retail, front desk, housekeeping, vehicle detailing/cleaning or related industry are

encouraged to apply

• Light mechanical aptitude

• Clean driving record

• Strong computer Skills – Excel, Outlook, Word

• Ability to learn reservations software system quickly

• Ability to lift 50 lbs

• Passion for travel, adventure and the general outdoors

• Positive, engaging attitude

DETAILS:

• On-site position (remote work not available)

• Seasonal position with flex hours dependent on volume

• Compensation based on experience

At Summit Vista, we have a strong commitment to our employees. Our dedication to our staff shows in many ways, including our benefits. We offer a great benefit package consisting of health insurance, dental insurance, vision insurance, company paid life insurance, short term and long-term disability, 401k, accrued vacation, paid holidays, bereavement leave, tuition reimbursement, employee assistance program, flexible spending accounts, and much more…

ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS: include the following. Other duties may be assigned. 

- Provide superior service to our customers (internal and external).

- Assist in maintaining, tracking, analyzing, and developing new quality control measures and data to insure each department delivers quality service in an efficient manner.

- Ensure that all departments under his or her leadership meets financial and general reporting goals and deadlines.

- Develop, implement and improve safety/emergency services procedures and programs.

- Periodic surveys and audits of facilities and grounds to ensure compliance with safety related legal requirements.

- Collection, analysis, and identification of the causes and trends of safety and emergency service related losses of company resources and assets.

-    Establishment and maintenance of liaison efforts with federal, state and local law enforcement and fire department agencies.

- Review and approve all incident reports.

- Ensure timely evaluations and job training for all staff.

- Ensure that appropriate safety procedures are followed by all employees.

- Coordinate timekeeping, work schedules and activities of maintenance and custodial workers.

- Plan, supervise and coordinate all daily building and grounds maintenance and custodial operations/tasks.

- Responsible for meeting with department on a routine basis.

- Responsible for departmental purchasing and supplies.

EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE:

PHYSICAL DEMANDS/WORKING CONDITIONS:

https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/913898.name: Regional Construction Accountant
https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/913898.description:
ANY APPLICANT INTERESTED IN THIS POSITION NEEDS TO BE HIGH ENERGY, ABLE TO HANDLE MULTIPLE TASKS AT ONCE, AND WORK INDEPENTANTLY.

This position will start at $48,000/ year salary. After 3 months there will be a performance review which may result in pay increase.

Are you looking for a fulfilling accounting role, that will challenge and excite you? You’ll be part of a great team that’s totally committed to cooperation, collaboration and innovation, to provide ever-evolving accounting services to a consistently growing, national commercial framing company.

You’ll be appreciated for your independence, enthusiasm, pride and personality, as much as for your accuracy, dependability, knowledge and integrity.

Responsibilities

You’ll be relied upon to develop close relationships with our Project Managers, our Customers, our Vendors and our Regional General Managers.

Administering the following. . .

- Working closely with the Project Mangers on customer invoicing, ensuring the Customer receives a timely, complete and accurate pay application.

- Coordinate with the Customer to collect receivables and coordinate waivers or pre-liens as needed.

- Organize with the Vendors to collect lien release waivers and the Project Managers to ensure timely invoice approvals are received.

- Reporting back to Regional General Managers on progress and status of their jobs.

- While enthusiastically taking on other accounting projects and working closely with the AR & Contracts Manger and the AP Manager.

Qualifications

You’ll need to have a great knowledge of accounting principles; be streamlined and accurate, with a great eye for detail; and be an effective communicator, who we can depend on to effectively manage expectations.

Experience is important and will be working in Sage 300 and MS Excel; but most importantly, you need to have passion and heart for what you do!

Additional Information

You’ll be rewarded both financially and in other ways, with generous salary, bonuses, health plan, untapped potential for growth and other benefits.

If this sounds like the position for you, please respond with your resume and a cover letter that answers the following 2 questions:

- What do you feel you can bring to the team, that nobody else can?

- What’s your greatest achievement in life?

Good luck and we look forward to welcoming you onto our team!

https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/912789.name: Laborer (Rotating Shifts)
https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/912789.description:
Laborer

 

Summary

This position involves various manual tasks including, but not limited to, the following: shoveling; sweeping; steam cleaning; painting; tire work; mechanical assistance; lifting, pushing and pulling various objects and raking. Work will be performed per the supervisor's instruc­tion, free from direct supervision except for more complicated jobs. Must be willing to learn new tasks as well as all aspects of our crushing operation. Positive safety attitude is a must. Rotating day shift and night shift; every two weeks. 

 

Supervisory Responsibilities

None

Qualifications

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skills, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disability to perform the essential functions.

Education and/or Experience

- High School diploma or GED is preferred. Related Experience is a plus.

Language Skills

- Ability to follow verbal and written instruction.

Mathematical Skills

- Basic Math

Reasoning Ability

- Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out detailed, but uninvolved written or oral instructions

Computer Skills

- None

Certificates, Licenses, Registrations

- Valid driver’s is required.

Physical Demands

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

 

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit, talk, or hear. The employee is frequently required to sit, climb, and use hands to finger, handle, or feel. The employee is occasionally required to stand, walk, crawl, kneel, bend, and reach with hands and arms above their shoulders. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move any where up to 100 lbs. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision and depth perception. Must be able to do hard work, and work in the heat. Able to run Compaction equipment, check grade. Be dependable.

Work Environment

The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

 

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is occasionally exposed to wet and/or humid conditions; moving mechanical parts; outside weather conditions; and extreme cold and/or heat. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.

Competencies

To perform the job successfully, an individual should demonstrate the following competencies:

None

Other Skills and Abilities

Ability to speak a Spanish language a plus

MSHA Certification

Other Qualifications

None

Statewide Community Outreach Manager

 

Requisition ID: 2021-3536

 

# of Openings:

1

 

Location: US-UT

 

Category:

Program Management & Support

 

Position Type:

Benefited Full-Time

 

Job Classification:

Exempt

 

College:

Jon M Huntsman School of Business

 

Department:

Marketing & Strategy

 

Advertised Salary:

Commensurate with experience, with excellent benefits

 

Overview

 

Working in collaboration with the Utah Women & Leadership Project (UWLP) Director and Associate Director, the Statewide Outreach Manager (Program Coordinator II) will be involved in the planning and implementation of statewide research, resources, and events that align with the overall mission and goals of the UWLP. This includes developing local partnerships and collaborations across the state; planning local level events; assessing and developing new resources for underserved populations; research and writing reports and grants; and coaching individuals and teams on related topics and initiatives.

 

Responsibilities

 

40% LOCAL PARTNERSHIPS/COLLABORATIONS AND OUTREACH

 

• Develops relationships with Extension and Statewide Campus administrators, faculty, and staff across the state to design and implement an effective outreach plan.

• Develops relationships and partnerships with municipality and county leaders to expand UWLP and reach into all corners of the state.

• Collaborates with local leaders to plan community-level programs and initiatives that align with Project mission and goals.

• Assists in planning and executing forums, seminars, workshops, or other types of events within counties and municipalities around Utah.

 

25% RESEARCH AND WRITING:

 

• Coordinates and manages teams of researchers, as needed, for state and local level projects.

• In partnership with the Director and Associate Director, engages in researching, writing, and editing reports on a wide variety of topics surrounding Utah women at the local level.

• Works on research and writing for local, institutional, state, and federal grants.

 

20% RESOURCES DEVELOPMENT AND SPECIAL INITIATIVES:

 

• Works with Director in conceiving, planning, and overseeing special initiatives and programs, creates and disseminates related resources.

• Works with Director on the creation and dissemination of related Project resources, specifically focused on underserved populations (e.g., rural, multicultural, LGBTQ).

• In partnership with the Director and Associate Director, assists in designing and implementing high quality evaluation tools.

• Facilitate research, programs, and solutions into populations that have been largely ignored.

• Manages student workers and volunteers.

 

15% COACHING:

 

• Coach individual women in various communities on topics related to our research, including navigating the transition from home to workplace and pandemic recovery for women and work.

• Coach community groups and teams around Utah.

• Direct individuals and organizations to research, resources, and experts on specific topics.

 

Qualifications

 

Minimum Qualifications

 

• Graduation from an accredited institution with a master's degree in English, Communication, Political Science, Composition, or a directly related field of study.

• Minimum of three (3) years research, writing, and publishing experience, with evidence of successfully managing projects and relationships.

 

Preferred Qualifications

 

• Doctoral degree from an accredited institution in related field

• Five (5) years of experience related to summary of duties

 

Required Documents

 

Along with the online application, please attach:

 

1. Resume/CV to be uploaded in the Candidate Profile

 

2. Contact Information for three Professional References

 

3. Writing Samples to be uploaded in the Candidate Profile 'Other Documents' (1-10)

 

4. Cover Letter to be typed/pasted into a text box at the end of the application

 

**Document size may not exceed 10 MB.**

 

Advertised Salary

 

Commensurate with experience, with excellent benefits

 

ADA

 

Employees work indoors and are protected from weather and/or contaminants, but not, necessarily, occasional temperature changes. The employee is regularly required to sit and often uses repetitive hand motions.

 

University Highlights

 

The mission of the Utah Women & Leadership Project is to strengthen the impact of Utah girls and women. We serve Utah and its residents by 1) producing relevant, trustworthy, and applicable research; 2) creating and gathering valuable resources; and 3) convening trainings and events that inform, inspire, and ignite growth and change for all Utahns.

 

Download the Utah Women & Leadership Project https://www.usu.edu/uwlp/files/UWLP-brochure.pdf

 

Utah State University (USU) was founded in 1888 and is honored to be Utah’s land-grant and space-grant university. USU is a Carnegie RU/H (Research University/High Research Activity) institution with approximately 27,700 students (24,660 undergraduates and 3,040 graduate students) on the Logan main campus. Utah State’s statewide system features eight campuses and 23 education centers and serves all counties in the state with Extension programs. USU offers 114 undergraduate majors, 132 graduate programs, and a variety of innovative stackable associate and certificate credentials. https://washingtonmonthly.com/2019college-guide/national in 2019 and the https://washingtonmonthly.com/2018college-guide/national in 2018. As one of the two premier research institutions in Utah, USU is proud to provide a high-quality education at an affordable price. Additional information about Utah State University can be found https://www.usu.edu/about/at-a-glance/.

 

A core characteristic of USU is engagement with communities and people in economic development, improvements to quality of life, and human capital. Through the practical application of knowledge, the University and its faculty engage and share expertise with the state, nation, and world, preserving the historical land-grant tradition of partnering with communities to address critical societal issues in the interest of the public good.

 

The USU main campus is located in beautiful https://www.loganutah.org/; a city of about 50,000 situated in a picturesque mountain valley about 80 miles north of Salt Lake City. Outstanding recreational opportunities abound in the nearby mountains and proximate region.

Associate Director

Exempt

Jon M Huntsman School of Business

Marketing & Strategy

Commensurate with experience, with excellent benefits

 

Overview

 

Working in collaboration with the Utah Women & Leadership Project (UWLP) Director, the Associate Director (Program Specialist) will be involved in the planning and implementation of research, resources, and events that align with the overall mission and goals of the UWLP. This includes research, writing, and editing; strategic and project planning; team management; resource development and initiative creation; fundraising and outreach; and involvement with other elements of the Project.

 

Responsibilities

 

35% RESEARCH/WRITING/TEAM MANAGEMENT:

 

• Manages teams of researchers and writers.

• Researches, writes, and edits reports on a wide variety of topics surrounding Utah women and other related areas.

• Creates timelines and projections for producing long-term research efforts.

• Identifies and works with community and state experts to ensure quality of research reports.

 

30% STRATEGIC/PROJECT PLANNING, PARTNERSHIP/COLLABORATIONS, AND PROGRAM REPRESENTATION:

 

• Works with Director in developing the overall strategic directions of the Project.

• Plans programs and initiatives that align with Project mission and goals.

• Manages communication with campus and community partners and collaborators, representing the Project as a key team member.

• As needed, assists in planning and executing forums, seminars, workshops, and other types of events.

• On occasion, delivers presentations on various topics to community and school groups.

• Represents Project to media outlets and community groups, as needed.

 

20% FUNDRAISING:

 

• Explores and identifies individuals and corporations that have an interest in donating.

• Works with development offices to coordinate any requests for current or future potential funding.

• Explores grants that align with the program mission and objectives.

• Coordinates with grant office to write, edit, refine, and submit grant proposals.

• Manages logistics of all donations, including communication with donors.

• Facilitates regular communication with all ongoing and potential donors to maintain strong relationships and ensure donors are engaged and satisfied with the partnership.

 

15% RESOURCES, SPECIAL INITIATIVES, AND EVALUATION:

 

• Works with Director in conceiving, planning, and overseeing special initiatives and programs, creates and disseminates related resources.

• Works with Director on the creation and dissemination of related Project resources, including idea sheets, podcasts, and infographics.

• In partnership with the Director, designs and implements the evaluation of research, programs, and other initiatives.

 

Qualifications

 

Minimum Qualifications

 

• Graduation from an accredited institution with a master's degree in English, Communication, Political Science, Composition, or a directly related field of study.

• Minimum of five (5) years research, writing, and publishing experience, with evidence of successfully managing projects and relationships.

 

Preferred Qualifications

 

• Doctoral degree from an accredited institution in related field

• Seven (7) years of experience related to summary of duties

 

Required Documents

 

Along with the online application, please attach:

 

1. Resume/CV to be uploaded in the Candidate Profile

 

2. Contact Information for three Professional References

 

3. Writing Sample(s) to be uploaded in the Candidate Profile 'Other Document (1-10)

 

4. Cover Letter to by typed/pasted into a text box at the end of the application

Weidner Apartment Homes is now hiring for an Apartment Maintenance Technician! If you have experience working in building maintenance, enjoy working with a team and are looking to work for a company with strong stability look no further we have the job for you!

We recognize the Apartment Maintenance Technician is the core of the resident experience. Not only are they troubleshooting and solving various maintenance issues, they are going into the homes of our residents. This is a huge responsibility and we value the level of customer care it takes to do this well. Most of all, Apartment Maintenance Technicians enjoy the work they do and continuously help create the resident experience.

Overview

 

Utah State University is looking for a qualified candidate to fill a full time position in the USU Aggie Creamery, working in the Gary H. Richardson Dairy Products Laboratory as a Food Processing Technician. This is a day shift position, 5 days a week, with nights, weekends and holidays OFF. Qualified candidate will be part of a dynamic team that is directly involved with the success of The Aggie Creamery in Teaching, Research, and Production of high quality dairy products.

 

Responsibilities

 

Successful candidate's primarily responsibilities include:

 

• Raw milk receiving, pasteurizer operation, batching ice cream mix, ice cream production, processing fluid milk, keeping the plant environment clean and will be directly involved with dismantling, cleaning, set up, and operation of all other dairy processing equipment.

• Work with sales to ensure ice cream inventory is complete and product is available to customers.

• Work with the Production Coordinator in conducting inspections and audits initiated by regulatory agencies.

 

Qualifications

 

Minimum Qualifications:

 

• Previous dairy processing is preferred, but not necessary.

• Knowledge and use of computer programs (Excel, Word, Database)

• Must be willing to work in cold (freezer) and wet (cleaning) environments.

• Must possess effective time management skills, be a self starter, and work independently.

• Be prompt, teachable, willing to assist others, and ready to be a part of a great team environment.

 

Preferred Qualifications:

 

• Two years of experience; or an associate degree/vocational training; or an equivalent combination of education plus experience.

 

Required Documents

 

Along with the online application, please attach:

 

1. Resume to be uploaded in the Candidate Profile

 

2. Cover Letter to be typed/pasted into a text box at the end of the application
