Primary Responsibilities:

 The Automobile Salesperson is expected to:

 * Protect the legal, financial and moral well-being of the Larry H. Miller Companies dealerships;

 * Understand and adhere to group sales process to promote sales and customer service satisfaction;

 * Be a teacher to support the efforts of other employees to be successful.

 * Seek ways to improve business operations efficiencies and customer service.

 1. Maximum productivity, customer service and profitability.

 * Adhere to Larry H. Miller sales process to achieve or exceed group standards such as sales production, gross profit and applicable benchmarks which result in profitability and customer service satisfaction.

 * Maintain thorough knowledge of current automotive products, features, benefits, specifications, prices, options, models and equipment to effectively communicate with customers and exceed customer satisfaction benchmarks.

 * Accurately review sales orders and invoices for proper completion and calculations.

 * Effectively communicate with and perform all job duties requested by management.

 * Ensure safe operation and transportation of all vehicles at all times and adhere to all OSHA and LHM policy requirements.

 2. Operate with integrity:

 * Demand the highest ethical standards from self and others.

 * Set an example of positive attitude and professionalism, including a neat, orderly and safe work environment.

 * Resolve customer complaints in a timely and professional manner.

 Job Qualifications:

 * High School diploma or equivalent

 * Desirable: 1+years of sales experience

 * Computer literate. Desirable: working knowledge of Larry H. Miller Group's current company management systems

 * Good organization skills

 * Professional communication skills

 * Detail oriented

 * Maintain valid driver's license and MVR within company policy requirements.

 Physical Requirements:

 * Work performed in an office and dealership settings due to the necessity to work with customers in person as well as coach and mentor employees in person.

 * Ethics/Integrity- the individual represents the Larry H. Miller Group of Companies by conducting his/her self in a professional and courteous business manner that demonstrates integrity and avoids the actual or perception of a conflict of interest.

 * Oral Communication- the individual clearly identifies and professionally expresses issues in positive or negative situations.

 * Planning/Organizing- the individual prioritizes and plans work activities and uses time efficiently.

 * Quality- the individual demonstrates accuracy and thoroughness and monitors own work to ensure quality.

 * Dependability- the individual is consistently at work and on time, follows instructions, responds to management direction and solicits feedback to improve performance.

 * Safety and Security- the individual observes safety and security procedures and uses equipment and materials properly.

https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/826241.name: *DRIVERS*   *STOP AND READ*
https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/826241.description:
Do yourself a favor and read this.

Don’t be mislead by unachievable incentives and or CRAZY sign on bonuses. The higher the sign on bonus, the higher the desperation. These company’s don’t pay the full bonus up front knowing that chances are that the new hire won’t stay in the seat long enough to collect it in full. It’s just bait to get you in the door.

I do provide a $500 start bonus just to help with getting back on your feet if you’ve been between jobs. These big company’s have high turn over rates due to the “deal with it” attitude from managers that’s never been in the seat, and from being paired up with a steering wheel holder. We only hire professionals so you’ll be paired up with a professional, not a slob with a bad attitude.

We’re straight shooters, sadly, some are dishonest or misleading as many of you already know. Some advertise .65 cents per mile, Do yourself a favor and ask to see a complete and current payroll. Most will decline your request or give you the run-around. You’ll generally find the .65 to be unachievable. Or very few drivers within the company that actually make that. These rates are made up of either fuel conservation incentives and mileage threshold incentives that are typically not realistic.

Our drivers average $1,500 - $1,700 or more a week with a payroll to back it up, plus benefits and bonuses.

Most of my hiring is done by word of mouth from current happy drivers. We’ve just added 3 trucks and have just 2 seats left.

I have 1 solo position available for a Reefer truck.

1 part time local position available, 2 nights a week and a solo run

Husband and wife teams are welcome, Have a buddy? Bring him with you and we'll put you in your own truck with no bouncing around. Plus a referral bonus.

Fowles Investments has been contracting with FEDEX GROUND since 2000.

We maintain a happy work environment and back up our drivers. I do not tolerate bad attitudes. You won’t find any here.

We are large enough to accommodate time off and provide flexibility but small enough to work with you on a personal level. Be respected and treated like a professional, not a number.

Both managers have been OTR and know trucks and the business, We have the lowest turnover rate out of the salt lake city terminal. We have several drivers that have been with us for 10 years plus and others that have retired happily with us.

Fed Ex Ground has the smoothest logistics in the biz, this equals more miles and less time on the road.

*Home every weekend*

*Top Pay Rates.

*New Fleet.

*100% Drop & Hook, Terminal to Terminal, No Touch Freight.*

*Full Health Insurance / Dental / Vision / Benefits Package after 30 days.

*Yearly Vacation Pay.*

*Safety / performance Bonus of up to $850.00 + paid every 6 months.

*Clean D.O.T Inspection Bonuses.

*NO forced dispatch, we are flexible if you have personal business to attend.

*Paid hotels and layover pay in the event of a layover. (RARE)

*Paid satellite radio with wireless headsets.

*Upgraded pillow-top mattresses.

*Fridge in every truck.

If you don’t have a CDL or enough experience, I can enroll you in school to get you started in a new exciting and fruitful career. I’ll pair you with a well seasoned trainer with a great attitude.

Call or text Jared @ (801) 710-3938 and I’ll be happy to answer any of your questions. Thanks

https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/918201.name: Product Designer (Remote)
https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/918201.description:
SUMMARY

AT ICON Health and Fitness we are passionate about empowering people to change their lives and achieve healthy, sustainable results. We strive to continuously push the limits to bring our customers cutting-edge products that will help them in every aspect of their lives. We are currently seeking a motivated individual to join our team as a Senior Product Designer.

The iFit Creative Team is growing, and we’re looking for an experienced Senior Product Designer to join us as we build products and experiences that empower our broad and diverse user base all around the world. Bringing together both User Experience and User Interface design skill sets, this role often oversees and executes a project from inception to completion.

The Senior Product Designer will continuously drive our digital products forward, collaborating with a talented, multidisciplinary team to discover valuable insights from customers and stakeholders alike, transforming that information into intuitive and accessible designs and interfaces that align both business and customer needs into elegant, cohesive solutions.

As a natural leader, the Senior Product Designer will overcome roadblocks, align expectations, and drive projects forward. Always keeping the end goal in mind, they will constantly evaluate the current direction and allocation of efforts, as well as how those may or may not need to be readdressed to meet project requirements and deadlines.

A champion of the user, the Senior Product Designer will pursue a user-centered approach to their work. They will understand the needs and concerns of our customers and utilize that information to drive results, not only for the business, but also for the users.

As a seasoned designer, they will have extensive experience with interactive design, design systems, mobile and desktop applications, content discovery, and consumer fitness technologies.

https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/911166.name: Landscaper; Irrigation Tech
https://jobs.ksl.com/listing/911166.description:
In need of a self motivated, reliable and trainable individuals that have transportation to our shop Monday through Friday, and can work 8-10 hrs a day. Part-time work is available as well 2-3 days a week. Our shop is located in Salt Lake county off of I-80 and State Street. We do property maintenance on residential and commercial properties.

Reliability, trainability and able to work as a team are the most important factors we consider when hiring a new team members.

Weekly Pay

Start at $16-$20 plus per hr. seasonal unemployment if you qualify

We provide tools and trucks

Company shirts and sweatshirts provided

Looking to fill multiple positions for our company.

Irrigation technician; must be able to evaluate and fix irrigation systems, from wiring to valve and manifold replacement, fixing & changing sprinkler heads and able to fix irrigation line breaks, stop and waste replacement and back flow preventer service. Must be willing to dig and do the manual labor needed for the repairs. Experience is preferred, but will train the right person.

Landscape Maintenance; must have the ability to operate mowers of varying size, blade edger, string trimmers, leaf blowers, and tools such as hedge trimmers & hand pruners. Experience is preferred, but will train the right person.

Must be able to lift 50lbs regularly

Enjoy working outside

Ability to pass a drug screening and background check
